reclaudo: <entryFree id="n40594" type="main" key="re_^claudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-claudo</orth>, v. recludo.</entryFree>
reclinatorium: <entryFree id="n40595" type="gloss" key="re_^cli_na_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^clīnātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>reclino</etym>; in <number>plur.</number>, <sense id="n40595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the back of a couch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reclinatoria vulgus appellat ornamenta lectorum, quae fulciunt toros sive caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 26, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40595.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The seat in a chariot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reclinis: <entryFree id="n40596" type="main" key="re_^cli_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^clīnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (dub. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^clī-nus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 4</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaning back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reclining</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word of the Aug. per., but not in Verg. or Hor.): <cit><quote lang="la">inque sinu juvenis positā cervice reclinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 558</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. renidens): in gramine floreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:90:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 90, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:470" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 470</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:535" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 535</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:161" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super pedes cubitantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40596.1" n="II" level="1"> Of things: tabula, <hi rend="ital">a projecting shelf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sellula,</quote> <trans><tr>a recliningchair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Reg. S. Pamsch. 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reclino: <entryFree id="n40597" type="main" key="re_^cli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-clīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clino, <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n40597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lean back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recline</hi> (class. but rare). </sense><sense id="n40597.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alces ad eas (arbores) se applicant atque ita paulum modo reclinatae quietem capiunt ... Huc cum se consuetudine reclinaverunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: caput, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=417" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 417</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habet ubi caput reclinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: scuta, <hi rend="ital">to lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora prona,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:369" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 369</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">reclinari ad suos (in dicendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in remoto gramine reclinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reclinatus in cubitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquod adminiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40597.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum ab labore me reclinat otium,</quote> <trans><tr>removes</tr>, <tr>releases me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem onus imperii reclinaret,</quote> <trans><tr>might lean</tr>, <tr>rest</tr>, <tr>be supported by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to revolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become rebellious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec arrogantibus verbis quidquam scripsit (Julianus), ne videretur subito reclinasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reclinus: <entryFree id="n40598" type="main" key="re_^cli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^clīnus</orth>, v. reclinis.</entryFree>
reclivis: <entryFree id="n40599" type="main" key="re_^cli_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-clīvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clivus</etym>, <sense id="n40599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaning backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">campo ad solem reclivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit> (al. reclines).—Form reclivus: nave reclivā, Ven. Fort. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recludo: <entryFree id="n40600" type="main" key="re_^clu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-clūdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-claudo</orth>, Coripp. 3 Joann. 118), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40600.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to re, II. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To unclose</hi> what had been closed, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay open; to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: resero, aperio, pando): pergam pultare ostium. Heus reclude: heus, Tranio, etiam aperis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus nemo in aedibus servat, neque qui recludat neque respondeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 82</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeratas hosti rēcludere portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:647" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 647</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 617</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 675</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 781</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam arcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:776" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reclusā Mane domo vigilare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adyta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora pecudum (in augury),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus quaerendis venis argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recludit se specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:424" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to dig up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem dente unco,</quote> <trans><tr>to break up</tr>, <tr>till</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 423</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the underworld: regna recludat Pallida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non optanda regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:523" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:231" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 231</bibl></cit>.— Of the grave: aequa tellus Pauperi <cb n="RECO" /> recluditur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contecta vulnera (with aperire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus mucrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 601</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ense pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:71" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 71</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ense jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw</tr>, <tr>unsheathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 646</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 423</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesauros tellure,</quote> <trans><tr>to disclose</tr>, <tr>reveal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 358</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 423</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 924</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ubi sol) caelum aestivā luce reclusit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 52</bibl></cit>.—Of springs: <cit><quote lang="la">ora fontana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:269" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">psittacus reclusus,</quote> <trans><tr>set free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 32</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40600.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: iram, <hi rend="ital">to unclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let loose</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdolus avaritiam ac libidinem occultans: quae postquam pecuniā reclusa sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrietas operta recludit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recludantur tyrannorum mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superas mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">principis justitiam, gravitatem, comitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus recludens immeritis mori Caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mercurius) Non lenis precibus fata recludere,</quote> <trans><tr>to relax</tr>, <tr>obviate the decrees of fate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40600.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shut off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi> (postclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">singulas separatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus a se separatas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronas in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam recluso Jani templo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:64" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 64</bibl>, dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">speculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:93" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40600.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cognatis a praetore apertum est, hoc agnatis esse reclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulā recludens omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 390</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reclusio: <entryFree id="n40601" type="main" key="re^clu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕclūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recludo</etym>, <sense id="n40601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unclosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reclusus: <entryFree id="n40602" type="main" key="re^clu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from recludo.</entryFree>
recoctus: <entryFree id="n40603" type="main" key="re^coctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from recoquo.</entryFree>
recogitatio: <entryFree id="n40604" type="main" key="re^co_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcōgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recogito</etym>, <sense id="n40604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recollection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Sup. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recogitatus: <entryFree id="n40605" type="main" key="re^co_gi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pall. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recogito: <entryFree id="n40606" type="main" key="re^co_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cōgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, no <sense id="n40606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">homunculi quanti sunt, quom recogito!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 29</bibl>: tu mihi videris de formā Minucianā in otio recogitasse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe mecum retractans ac recogitans, quam ... exoleverit disciplina ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">13: quidquid dixi cum recogito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: de nobis Deus, id. Jonae, 1, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Max. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recognitio: <entryFree id="n40607" type="main" key="re^cogni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcognĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recognosco, II.</etym>. <sense id="n40607.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A recognition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n40607.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reviewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi> (August.): <cit><quote lang="la">frequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <trans><tr>a review</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi dies ad recognitionem mutuam nundinis dantur,</quote> <trans><tr>for mutual inspection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <trans><tr>self-examination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:36:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per recognitionem Postumii consulis magna pars agri Campani recuperata in publicum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 19</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 119</bibl>, the correct read. is recordatio).</sense></entryFree>
recognosco: <entryFree id="n40608" type="main" key="re^cognosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cognosco</orth>, <itype>gnōvi, gnĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40608.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To know again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognize</hi>, i. q. recordor (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): se non tum illa discere, sed reminiscendo recognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit> (just before, recordari); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam et furtum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">18: ea, quae scit, mecum recognoscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem illam superiorem mecum recognosce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te penitus recognovi, timere desino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">personas quasdam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: in quibus (litteris) mirificum tuum erga me amorem recognovi, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res (suas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia certaminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra eruta annalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille se imperatorem cognosceret,</quote> <trans><tr>feel himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40608.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">review</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect</hi>, i. q. recenseo (so most freq. since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam non recognoscimus nunc leges populi Romani sed aut repetimus ereptas aut novas scribimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios navales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: ergastula, Suet. <pb n="1535" /> <cb n="RECO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:32" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellectilem Darei et omnem pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia ergastuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum rusticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum (gregis, militum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sigillum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243, 8</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: (Caesar triumphans) Dona recognoscit populorum, <hi rend="ital">surveys</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 721</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n40608.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi> a writing in respect to its genuineness and value; <hi rend="ital">to certify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authenticate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas in foro summā hominum frequentiā exscribo ... Haec omnia summā curā et diligentiā recognita et collata et ab hominibus honestissimis obsignata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum Pompeii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptum et recognitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos recognoscere et emendare,</quote> <trans><tr>to revise and correct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recogo: <entryFree id="n40609" type="hapax" key="re^co_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cōgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to collect again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres in corpora posse recogi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 309</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recolligo: <entryFree id="n40610" type="main" key="re^colli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-collĭgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gather again</hi> what has been scattered; <hi rend="ital">to gather up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40610.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsos ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem, quae passim vagabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 42, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nata ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: talos, Sen. poët. Apoc. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—Of a single object: <cit><quote lang="la">parvulum expositum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recollecto gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 33, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40610.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: quod scribis, etiam si cujus animus in te esset offensior, a me recolligi oportere, <hi rend="ital">to be reconciled</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ab imbecillitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se a longā valetudine,</quote> <trans><tr>to recover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 122</bibl></cit>; also with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take courage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 744</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primos annos,</quote> <trans><tr>to regain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recolloco: <entryFree id="n40611" type="main" key="re^collo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-collŏco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">replace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrum lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recolo: <entryFree id="n40612" type="main" key="re^co^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cŏlo</orth>, <itype>cŏlŭi, cuitum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to till</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cultivate again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to work anew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40612.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">desertam terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere humo post tempora longa recultae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:68" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metalla intermissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 24</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40612.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To inhabit again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revisit</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo libenter recolit, qui laesit locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40612.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exercise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practise again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40612.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: certum est, antiqua recolam et servibo mihi, <hi rend="ital">I</hi>'<hi rend="ital">ll drive the old trade again</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will lead again my old way of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas artes, quibus a pueris dediti fuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec studia recolenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: dignitatem, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 439, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia nostra meditatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avitum decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galbae imagines,</quote> <trans><tr>to set up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulos paternis sacerdotiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to reinvest</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: diem dapibus, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 262.— </sense><sense id="n40612.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40612.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego quom ago Cum meo animo et recolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si tecum ipse recolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua facta pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tua, nam recolo, quondam germana canebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 113</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Hilar. Trin. 1, 17: haec in corde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40612.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To contemplate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi>: inclusas animas ... Lustrabat studio recolens omnemque suorum Forte recensebat numerum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 681</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40613" type="hapax" key="re^co_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cōlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strain again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum per linteum duplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 268" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 268</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recomminiscor: <entryFree id="n40614" type="hapax" key="re^commi^niscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-commĭniscor</orth>, <itype>nisci</itype>, <sense id="n40614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recall to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect</hi>: litteris recomminiscar, <hi rend="ital">C</hi> est principium nomini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recommoneo: <entryFree id="n40615" type="main" key="re^commo^neo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-commŏneo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remind again</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Compl. Apoc. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad 1</bibl> Tim. 4.</sense></entryFree>
recompingo: <entryFree id="n40616" type="hapax" key="re^compingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcompingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join together again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reunite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os ad os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recompono: <entryFree id="n40617" type="main" key="re^compo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-compōno</orth>, no <sense id="n40617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40617.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put together again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reunite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rearrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readjust</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracturam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 47, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40617.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to soothe again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall to composure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 5</bibl>. <cb n="RECO" /></sense></entryFree>
reconciliatio: <entryFree id="n40618" type="main" key="re^conci^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕconcĭlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reconcilio</etym>, <sense id="n40618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a re-establishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reinstatement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: gratiae suae et Pompeii, <hi rend="ital">a reconciliation</hi>, Balb. et Opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:24:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 24, 51</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">reconciliationes gratiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. ad Quir. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">a reconciling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconciliation</hi> (mostly postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">irridebatur haec illius reconciliatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil opus esse reconciliatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calvo de reconciliatione per amicos agenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">simulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohata inter fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium reconciliationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii societatem reconciliationibus variis male focillatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reconciliator: <entryFree id="n40619" type="hapax" key="re^conci^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕconcĭlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippa populi reconciliator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 18, p. 276, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reconciliatrix: <entryFree id="n40620" type="main" key="re^conci^li^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕconcĭlĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reconciliator</etym>, <sense id="n40620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reconciler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reconcilio: <entryFree id="n40621" type="main" key="re^conci^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-concĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n40621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> reconciliasso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 44</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, reconciliassere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40621.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reunite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconcile</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">me cum C. Caesare reducit, reconciliat, restituit in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:50:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 50, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus eum omnibus eadem res publica reconciliavit, quae alienarat,</quote> <trans><tr>reunited</tr>, <tr>reconciled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 12, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum sorori tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum animos imperatori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem senatus nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 8, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to make friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conciliate</hi>, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, C, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">cura reconciliandi eos in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 58</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">To recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione Parum insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to re-establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scribis de reconciliatā nostrā, gratiā, non intellego, cur reconciliatam esse dicas, quae nunquam imminuta est,</quote> <trans><tr>restored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; 3, 12, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationem judiciorum amissam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturni laboris detrimentum sollertiā et virtute militum brevi reconciliatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 30, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:22" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam cum Thebanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:9" default="NO">31, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam de integro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: inimicitiam invicem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to appease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit> (corresp. to the previous inimicos): voluntatem, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:52" default="NO" valid="yes">52</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40621.2" n="II" level="1"> Ante-class., <hi rend="ital">to bring back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 65</bibl>: si hujus huc reconciliasso in libertatem filiam, ib. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">articulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 354, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reconcinno: <entryFree id="n40622" type="main" key="re^concinno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-concinno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (old <sense id="n40622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> reconcinnarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 3</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to set right again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tribus locis aedifico, reliqua reconcinno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinther,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: detrimentum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
reconcludo: <entryFree id="n40623" type="hapax" key="re^conclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-conclūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in monumento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
reconditio: <entryFree id="n40624" type="main" key="re^condi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcondĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rebuilding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 58" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 58</bibl>, Serm. 1, 6.</sense></entryFree>
reconditus: <entryFree id="n40625" type="main" key="re^condi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcondĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from recondo.</entryFree>
recondo: <entryFree id="n40626" type="main" key="re^condo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-condo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put back again; to lay up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stow away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoard; to shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close; to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bury</hi>, etc. (cf.: abscondo, occulo, retrudo, abdo). </sense><sense id="n40626.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium cruentatum in vaginam recondidit,</quote> <trans><tr>put up again</tr>, <tr>sheathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium in vaginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Lepidus flammae vi e rogo ejectus recondi propter ardorem non potuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>put back again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 186</bibl></cit>: reliquias (ciborum) aliquo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 78</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas in amphoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas in vasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">12: Caecubum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes aerario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum in annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to bury one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, Sen. <cb n="RECO" /> Ep. 8, 1: se in locum, ex quo, etc., <hi rend="ital">to hide one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod celari opus erat, habebant sepositum et reconditum,</quote> <trans><tr>hid away</tr>, <tr>concealed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam clausum neque tam reconditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">40: recondita alia invenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imo reconditus antro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 583</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 339</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 11</bibl> Duk. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51, 9</bibl> Drak., and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: oculos, <hi rend="ital">to close again</hi> (opp. erigere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 146</bibl>: avidā recondidit alvo, <hi rend="ital">hid</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">swallowed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 17</bibl>; cf.: cum subito Triton ore recondit aquam, <hi rend="ital">sucks in</hi>, i. q. absorbet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl> (3, 30), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem in pulmone,</quote> <trans><tr>to bury</tr>, <tr>sheathe</tr>, <tr>plunge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 387</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gladium lateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 482</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40626.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens alia visa sic arripit, ut his statim utatur, alia recondit, e quibus memoria oritur,</quote> <trans><tr>lays up</tr>, <tr>stores away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, vultus in crimen detorquens recondebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, odia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 69</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem interius recondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fama obscura recondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep secret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc me recondidi ... ut prodesse pluribus possem,</quote> <trans><tr>went into retirement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus quicquid arcani apparo, id Herc. Oet. 478: praecepta mea reconde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcondĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sequestered.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40626.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tabulis et signis propalam collocatis, sed his omnibus rebus constructis ac reconditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Aegyptus? ut occulte latet! ut recondita est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 207</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae auri argentique,</quote> <trans><tr>deep-lying</tr>, <tr>concealed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habemus senatus consultum, verum inclusum in tabulis, tamquam in vaginā reconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcondĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a secret place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-condĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sequestered places</hi>: Pergami in occultis ac reconditis templi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40626.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstruse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recondite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reconditae abstrusaeque res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, reconditiora, opp. quae in promptu sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reconditae exquisitaeque sententiae,</quote> <trans><tr>profound</tr>, <tr>recondite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 274</bibl></cit>: verba, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) speciem ita formavit oris, ut in eā penitus reconditos mores effingeret,</quote> <trans><tr>concealed</tr>, <tr>hidden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinctius naturā tristi ac reconditā fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>of a reserved disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
reconduco: <entryFree id="n40627" type="main" key="re^condu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-condūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40627.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hire anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to farm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contract for again</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">reconduxisse videbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 13, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notum est ab eodem Charmide unum aegrum ex provincialibus H. S. ducentis reconductum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>taken to cure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40627.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
reconfirmo: <entryFree id="n40628" type="main" key="re^confirmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕconfirmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n40628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strengthen again</hi>, Primas. II. Cor. 1.</sense></entryFree>
reconflo: <entryFree id="n40629" type="hapax" key="re^conflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-conflo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rekindle;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus per membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 927</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reconsigno: <entryFree id="n40630" type="hapax" key="re^consigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-consigno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
reconstringo: <entryFree id="n40631" type="main" key="re^constringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-constringo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind up again</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-Soran. Quu. Med. 251.</sense></entryFree>
recontrans: <entryFree id="n40632" type="main" key="re^contrans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-contrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contro</etym>, <sense id="n40632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rebellious</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gens recontrans regibus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reconvalesco: <entryFree id="n40633" type="main" key="re^conva^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-convălesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recover health again</hi> (late Lat.), Eunod. 1 Carm. 10.</sense></entryFree>
reconverto: <entryFree id="n40634" type="main" key="re^converto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕconverto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn back again</hi> (late Lat.), Facund. Def. 9, 4.</sense></entryFree>
recoquo: <entryFree id="n40635" type="main" key="re^co^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>coxi, coctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cook</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boil over again.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Peliam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: fessos aetate parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:444" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana recocta (in dyeing),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram (in the sun),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Velabrensi massa recocta fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:53:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 53, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40635.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare again by fire; to burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">forge again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">re coquunt patrios fornacibus enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 636</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">electrum aurumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1536" /> <cb n="RECO" /> 624: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40635.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: (Cicero se) Apollonio Moloni formandum ac velut recoquendum dedit, <hi rend="ital">to recast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remould</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl>: Fuffitio seni recocto, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lusty</hi> (alluding to the fable of Pelias), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 54, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scriba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus vino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. in Diom. p. 517</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
recordabilis: <entryFree id="n40636" type="main" key="re^corda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcordābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recordor</etym>, <sense id="n40636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may</hi> or <hi rend="ital">should be remembered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">memorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo recordabilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recordatio: <entryFree id="n40637" type="main" key="re^corda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcordātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recalling to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remembrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recordation</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n40637.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum memoria et recordatio jucunda sane fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coupled with memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (memoriam) quidem Plato recordationem esse vult vitae superioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit> (v. recordor <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">veteris memoriae recordatio,</quote> <trans><tr>the recollection of an old circumstance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praeteritae memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet praeteriti doloris secura recordatio delectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:266" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 266</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum benefactorum recordatio jucundissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatio impudicitiae et stuprorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 110</bibl></cit> Zumpt and Halm <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 22</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiit recordatio egisse me juvenem aeque in quadruplici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">das mihi jucundas recordationes conscientiae nostrae rerumque earum, quas gessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40637.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti malorum memoriā torquentur, sapientes bona praeterita gratā recordatione renovata delectant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acerba recordatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subit recordatio: quot dies quam frigidis rebus absumpsi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordationes fugio, quae quasi morte quādam dolorem efficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recordativus: <entryFree id="n40638" type="hapax" key="re^corda_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcordātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to recollection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recordative;</hi> in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">recordativa species verborum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the pluperfect tense</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 313</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recordatus: <entryFree id="n40639" type="main" key="re^corda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcordātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recollection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remembrance</hi> (post-class. for the class. recordatio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Psych. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recordo: <entryFree id="n40640" type="main" key="re^cordo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcordo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. recordor <sense id="n40640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
recordor: <entryFree id="n40641" type="main" key="re^cordor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cordor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n40641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cor</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40641.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bethink one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be mindful of</hi> a thing (as the result of the reminisci, the recalling of it to memory), <hi rend="ital">to call to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remember</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">recognosco): quod jam pueri ita celeriter res innumerabiles arripiant, ut eas non tum primum arripere videantur, sed reminisci et recordari. Haec sunt Platonis fere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed parum est me hoc meminisse: spero etiam te, qui oblivisci nihil soles, nisi injurias, reminiscentem recordari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.— Constr. </sense><sense id="n40641.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">pueritiae memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes gradus aetatis tuae (with considero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperationes eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus meritum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 28, 69</bibl></cit> Wund. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">de/rreis,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusationem legationis obeundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communes belli casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes (Manlii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta pueritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priorem libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feralem introitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facta priora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem Anchisae magni voltumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 774</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam virtutem animique magnitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>;
