so, <cit><quote lang="la">tua in me studia et officia multum tecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus vitam et naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 25, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rite audita recordor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum recorder non M. Brutum ... sed legiones nostras in eum locum saepe profectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 75</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordatus quod nihil cuiquam toto die praestitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea, quae ... recordanda et cogitanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40641.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: recordabantur, eadem se superiore anno in Hispaniā perpessos, Caes. B. <cb n="RECR" /> C. 3, 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 705</bibl>: hoc genus poenae saepe in improbos civis esse usurpatum recordatur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 5</bibl>; and, acc. to the analogy of memini, with <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego recordor longe omnibus unum anteferre Demosthenem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40641.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitus re ipsā recordor, quantum hae quaestiones punctorum nobis detraxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordor unde ceciderim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:4:16:10" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40641.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (freq. in late Lat.; in Cic. only in two foll. passages, for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 28, 69</bibl>, the true read. is meritum): <cit><quote lang="la">recordans superioris tuae transmissionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiorum suorum recordabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacti mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis Domini, id. Amos, 6, 11: verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 24, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si meliore memoriā es, velim scire, ecquid de te recordere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 7, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 35</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et, ut recordor, tibi meam (epistulam) misi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40641.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To think of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi> something future (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego non tantum, quae sum passura, recordor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium captivitatem et miserrimam servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.?*! </sense><sense id="n40641.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form recordavit, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:6:46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 6, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40641.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad recordata poenalis vitae debita,</quote> <trans><tr>preserved in the memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
recorporatio: <entryFree id="n40642" type="main" key="re^corpo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcorpŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recorporo</etym>, a <sense id="n40642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnishing again with a body</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flesh; the restoration of the body to its former state</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1</bibl> prooem.; 1, 4, 112.</sense></entryFree>
recorporativus: <entryFree id="n40643" type="main" key="re^corpo^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcorpŏrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves to restore the body to its former condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restorative</hi> (a late medic. word): <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recorporo: <entryFree id="n40644" type="main" key="re^corpo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-corpŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish again with a body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restore the body to</hi> (animam) <hi rend="ital">its former condition</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argillam in materiam robustiorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
recorrigo: <entryFree id="n40645" type="main" key="re^corri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-corrĭgo</orth>, <itype>rexi, rectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40645.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">correct again</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">costas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to set right again</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40645.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to amend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 50:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad regulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recrastino: <entryFree id="n40646" type="main" key="re^crasti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-crastĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crastinus</etym>, <sense id="n40646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put off from day to day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to procrastinate</hi> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recreabilis: <entryFree id="n40647" type="main" key="re_^cre^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^crĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recreo</etym>, <sense id="n40647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">refreshing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recreatio: <entryFree id="n40648" type="hapax" key="re^cre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcrĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aegritudine,</quote> <trans><tr>recovery</tr>, <tr>convalescence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recreator: <entryFree id="n40649" type="main" key="re^cre^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcrĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviver</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporum somnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">OMNIVM MVNERVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1095, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recrementum: <entryFree id="n40650" type="main" key="re^cre_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-crēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cerno</etym>, <sense id="n40650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recrement</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chaff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 41, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 65</bibl>.— Of human <hi rend="ital">excrements</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recremo: <entryFree id="n40651" type="main" key="re_^cre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^-crĕmo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cremo</etym>, <sense id="n40651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn utterly</hi>: nec recremanda foris, sed recreanda polis, Ven. Fort. Carm. 9, 2, 114.</sense></entryFree>
recreo: <entryFree id="n40652" type="main" key="re^cre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-crĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">create anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: reficio, reparo): lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 759</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:277" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 277</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 323</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 46, § 155</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: Athenae recreaverunt vitam legesque rogarunt, <hi rend="ital">transformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reformed life</hi> (by agriculture), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 289</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of baptism,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> C. 21, 465</bibl></cit>; and, jocosely: illic homo homines non alit, verum educat Recreatque, <hi rend="ital">he does not merely feed men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but fattens and transforms them</hi> (by much eating), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n40652.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to restore to a good condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi> in body or mind; and, mid., <hi rend="ital">to become refreshed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recruited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: reficio, relevo, erigo, confirmo). </sense><sense id="n40652.2" n="A" level="2"> In body: propterea capitur <cb n="RECT" /> cibus, ut suffulciat artus Et recreet vires interdatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 868</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex gravi morbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Red. ad Quir. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectu smaragdi recreatur acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">defectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leni vento umerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor aestivā recreatur aurā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuatum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potorem squillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semivivum ex acie elatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessos maniplos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:194" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40652.3" n="B" level="2"> In mind: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (litterae) mihi quiddam quasi animulae restillarunt: recreatum enim me non queo dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>revivified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reficere et recreare mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so coupled with reficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(discipulus) mutatione recreabitur sicut in cibis, quorum diversitate reficitur stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictum erexit, perditumque recreavit,</quote> <trans><tr>restored again to life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam afflictam, et perditam erigere atque recreare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91:section=212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego recreavi afflictos animos bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica revirescat et recreetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recreatus neque restitutus populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recreatur civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) cum se collegit atque recreavit,</quote> <trans><tr>has recovered itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris sustentor et recreor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem Pierio recreatis antro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: spatium interponendum ad recreandos animos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex magno timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recreatus ex metu mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc maerore recreari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: se ab illo tumore, Auct. B. Alex. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas debilitata tandem aequitate talium virorum recreëtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recreatur animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 168, 21.</sense></entryFree>
recrepo: <entryFree id="n40653" type="main" key="re^cre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-crĕpo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passages): cava cymbala recrepant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe lapis recrepat Cyllenia murmura (i. e. lyram) pulsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recresco: <entryFree id="n40654" type="main" key="re^cresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cresco</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">increase again</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo terra tibi libatur et aucta recrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favete nomini Scipionum, suboli imperatorum vestrorum, velut accisis recrescenti stirpibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecisa ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 87, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna pleno orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recretis crinibus,</quote> <trans><tr>that have grown again</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 560</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recrucifigo: <entryFree id="n40655" type="main" key="re^cru^ci^fi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcrŭcĭfīgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>re-, crux, and figo</etym>, <sense id="n40655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crucify anew</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ep. ad Gal. 3, 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recrudesco: <entryFree id="n40656" type="main" key="re^cru_desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-crūdesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become raw again.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n40656.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of wounds, <hi rend="ital">to break open afresh</hi>: nunc autem hoc tam gravi vulnere etiam illa, quae consanuisse videbantur, recrudescunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40656.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recrudescente Manlianā seditione,</quote> <trans><tr>breaking out again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recruduit pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recruduit soporatus odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recrudescit nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 231" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 231</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recta: <entryFree id="n40657" type="main" key="recta_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectā</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rectē</orth>, <sense id="n40657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. rego, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rectiangulum: <entryFree id="n40658" type="main" key="recti^angu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectĭangŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rectus-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n40658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a right-angled triangle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rectificatio: <entryFree id="n40659" type="main" key="recti^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rectus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n40659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the harmonizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconciling</hi> (late Lat.): contrariorum, Junii Part<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Div. Leg. 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rectio: <entryFree id="n40660" type="main" key="recti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direction</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 22, 61</bibl></cit> (Madv. conj. rerum publicarum rectionis genera).</sense></entryFree>
rectitator: <entryFree id="n40661" type="hapax" key="recti^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rectito, v. rego</etym>, <sense id="n40661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>: ratis rectitator, Poët. ap. Mar. Vict. p. 2551 P.</sense></entryFree>
rectitudo: <entryFree id="n40662" type="main" key="recti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rectus</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n40662.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Straightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directness.</hi> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Aggen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 46</bibl> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n40662.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">uprightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rectitude</hi> (class. aequitas), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 13 praef" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 13 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
recto: <entryFree id="n40663" type="main" key="recto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rego, <sense id="n40663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rector: <entryFree id="n40664" type="main" key="rector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n40664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a guider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi> (cf.: moderator, gubernator). </sense><sense id="n40664.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly post-Aug.), of <hi rend="ital">a helmsman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium rectores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2</bibl>. 186; 6, 232; 11, 482; 493; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; <pb n="1537" /> <cb n="RECU" /> of <hi rend="ital">a horseman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:138" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 4</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">an elephant-driver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 9</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a herdsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40664.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governor</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inesse aliquem non solum habitatorem in hac caelesti ac divinā domo, sed etiam rectorem et moderatorem et tamquam architectum tanti operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rector et gubernator civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 5</bibl>; 5, 4, 6; 6, 1, 1; 6, 13, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolopum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:481" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 481</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of the deity: quid sit summi rectoris ac domini numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>, so of Jupiter: <cit><quote lang="la">rector caelestūm, deūm, Olympi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 668</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 498</bibl>; 13, 599 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">of Neptune: pelagi, maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:331" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 331</bibl></cit>; 4, 797; 11, 207; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 61 al.</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the ruler</hi> of a province, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the commander</hi> of an army, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 173</bibl> Heyne; of <hi rend="ital">a master of youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tutor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum rector (sapiens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 38</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanim. or abstr. things: (sol) nec temporum modo terrarumque, sed siderum etiam ipsorum caelique rector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus incorruptus, aeternus, rector humani generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 3</bibl></cit>, and v. rectrix; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rectrix: <entryFree id="n40665" type="main" key="rectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rector</etym>, <sense id="n40665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that leads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guides; a directress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">animam velut aurigam rectricemque membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia domina rectrixque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia rectrix parensque mundi altera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rectura: <entryFree id="n40666" type="main" key="rectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rego</etym>. <sense id="n40666.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uprightness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 131" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 131</bibl> Goes. — </sense><sense id="n40666.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decuriarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rectus: <entryFree id="n40667" type="main" key="rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from rego.</entryFree>
recubitus: <entryFree id="n40668" type="main" key="re^cu^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recumbo</etym>, <sense id="n40668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling down; reclining at table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 72, § 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Cantic. Hom. 1, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recubo: <entryFree id="n40669" type="main" key="re^cu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie upon the back; to lie back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recline</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc tu, diva, tuo recubantem corpore sancto Circumfusa super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio recubare toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 392</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in antro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub tegmine fagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub quā arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 14, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:523" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 523</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recula: <entryFree id="n40670" type="main" key="re_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēcŭla</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>res</etym>. <sense id="n40670.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 613</bibl> P.; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 148</bibl>: resculae (al. reculae), Salv. c. Avar. 4, p. 166.— </sense><sense id="n40670.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a small estate</hi>, Don. Vit. Verg. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
recultus: <entryFree id="n40671" type="main" key="re^cultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from recolo.</entryFree>
recumbo: <entryFree id="n40672" type="main" key="re^cumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cumbo</orth>, <itype>cŭbui, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cumbo, cubo</etym>, <sense id="n40672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie down again; to lie down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40672.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n40672.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum primo perterritum somno surrexisse, dein, cum se collegisset ... recubuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exedrā lectulo posito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in herbā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spondā sibi propiore recumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:345" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros medio recumbere sulco,</quote> <trans><tr>to sink down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 539</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier sopita recumbit,</quote> <trans><tr>sinks into sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 794</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40672.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to recline at table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triclinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rediit hora dicta, recubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 21, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40672.4" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ne (pons) supinus eat cavāque in palude recumbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 713</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus (domūs quassatae) in proclinatas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nebulae magis ima petunt campoque recumbunt,</quote> <trans><tr>sink</tr>, <tr>settle down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 401</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minax ponto Unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 589" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juba) dextro jactata recumbit in armo,</quote> <trans><tr>falls</tr>, <tr>rolls down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: in umeros cervix collapsa recumbit, <hi rend="ital">sinks back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reclines</hi>, <cb n="RECU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem in terram recumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera Martialis longo Janiculi jugo recumbunt,</quote> <trans><tr>descend</tr>, <tr>slope down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duro monti recumbens Narnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:459" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 459</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recuperatio: <entryFree id="n40673" type="main" key="re^cu^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭpĕrātĭo, rĕcŭpĕrātīvus, rĕcŭpĕrātor, rĕcŭpĕrātōrĭus, rĕcŭ-pĕro</orth>, v. reciperatio, etc.</entryFree>
recuro: <entryFree id="n40674" type="main" key="re^cu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, * <sense id="n40674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to restore by taking care of; to refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure</hi>, = recreare; also, <hi rend="ital">to take care of; to prepare with care</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me otio et urticā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartam,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepare carefully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulo corpora laniata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, p. 183, 28.</sense></entryFree>
recurro: <entryFree id="n40675" type="main" key="re^curro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-curro</orth>, <itype>curri</itype> (recucurrit, only <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 99</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten back</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n40675.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ad anum recurro rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: recurrit rursus ad Hispalim Caesar, Auct. B. Hisp. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:75" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad raedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tusculanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipe te et recurre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam huc recurret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna tum crescendo, tum defectionibus in initia recurrendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fontem Xanthi versa recurret aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in suos fontes versa aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the revolving</hi> of the sun, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 100</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the year,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 147</bibl></cit>.—With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum saepe recurrat iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 360</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40675.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40675.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur posteris amplior honor quam majoribus haberetur? curve non retro quoque recurreret aequitas eadem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam expellas furca, tamen usque recurret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox Bruma recurrit iners,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recurrat versa hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:854" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudines anniversariae ac tempore certo recurrentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad easdem conditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uti eo recurrant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea unde generata, quo recurrant, viderit,</quote> <trans><tr>whither they return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec appellatio memoriae recurret,</quote> <trans><tr>will recur to memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (with admoneri and recordari): <cit><quote lang="la">recurrentes versus = reciproci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 14</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40675.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to have recourse to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recur to</hi> any thing (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">usu. decurro, q. v.): ad eam rationem recurrunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so, ad eos auctores, etc., id. prooem. § 17.</sense></entryFree>
recursio: <entryFree id="n40676" type="main" key="re^cursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recurro</etym>, <sense id="n40676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backward course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 911</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recursitans: <entryFree id="n40677" type="hapax" key="re^cursi^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcursĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [recurso], <sense id="n40677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">running back repeatedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequently returning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recurso: <entryFree id="n40678" type="main" key="re^curso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcurso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n40678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [recurro], <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten back; to come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n40678.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quid ego huc recursem? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 34</bibl>: (corpora) dissiliunt longe, longeque recursant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40678.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">urit atrox Juno et sub noctem cura recursat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa viri virtus animo . . . recursat,</quote> <trans><tr>recurs again to her mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo vetera omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animos illa audacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recursus: <entryFree id="n40679" type="main" key="re^cursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40679.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a running back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, etc. (not ante-Aug.; and in the poets mostly in the <number>plur.</number>; in the <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 454</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">inde alios ineunt cursus aliosque recursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut recursus pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dent modo fata recursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 59</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 593</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres missae spondere recursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celerem recursum precatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 86, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">per alternos undā labente recursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:423" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 423</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydia perfusa flexuosi amnis Maeandri recursibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>windings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poti liquoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Concr., <hi rend="ital">a returning path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(labyrinthus) itinerum ambages occursusque ac recursus inexplicabiles continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40679.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40679.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cb n="RECU" /> recursus ad bonam valetudinem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pristinum militiae ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40679.3" n="2" level="3"> Of vision, sight, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the power to bring back an image</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">specula, cum procul abducta sunt, faciem non reddunt, quia acies nostra non habet usque ad nos recursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40679.4" n="3" level="3"> In law t. t., <hi rend="ital">recourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad judicem a quo fuerit provocatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recurvo: <entryFree id="n40680" type="main" key="re^curvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-curvo</orth>, no <sense id="n40680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curve backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">equi colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caput aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios in vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:583" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 583</bibl></cit>. — In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucrone intus recurvato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os magis in exteriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae (Maeandri),</quote> <trans><tr>winding</tr>, <tr>serpentine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recurvus: <entryFree id="n40681" type="main" key="re^curvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-curvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">curved back</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word of the Aug. per.; also in post-Aug. prose; syn.: reduncus, repandus): cornu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 698</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibrae radicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:632" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae nexus,</quote> <trans><tr>winding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 664</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tectum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Labyrinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hooks</tr>, <tr>fishhooks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum (delphini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 113</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae ad buccinum recurvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recusabilis: <entryFree id="n40682" type="main" key="re^cu_sa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcūsābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recuso</etym>, <sense id="n40682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that should be rejected</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">revelatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
recusatio: <entryFree id="n40683" type="main" key="re^cu_sa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcūsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40683.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a declining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40683.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">disputationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidiana mea recusatio, Hirt. B. G. prooem. § 1: sine ullā recusatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine recusatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 90</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n40683.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <trans><tr>loathing</tr>, <tr>nausea</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40683.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang., </sense><sense id="n40683.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An objection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque haec tua recusatio confessio sit captae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 53, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena violatae religionis justam recusationem non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40683.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plea in defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counter-plea</hi> (opp. petitio): <cit><quote lang="la">judiciale (genus orationum) habet in se accusationem et defensionem, aut petitionem et recusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:5" default="NO">5, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recusativus: <entryFree id="n40684" type="main" key="re^cu_sa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcūsātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prohibitory</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Salut. Praecc. 22" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Salut. Praecc. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recuso: <entryFree id="n40685" type="main" key="re^cu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cūso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n40685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> of the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> recusantūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 16</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>causa</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40685.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make an objection against</hi>, in statement or reply; <hi rend="ital">to decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be reluctant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unwilling to do</hi> a thing, etc. (freq. and class.; cf.: abnuo, renuo, denego); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40685.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: uxorem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me judicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populum Romanum disceptatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quae pepigere recusent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum periculum communis salutis causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nullum periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 68</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:10" default="NO">12, 11, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nisi hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla (leones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 749</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tibi a me postulanti recusabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29, 128</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">psalteria virginibus probis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de poenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de stipendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quod ab altero postularent, in se recusarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ptolemaeus recusabat regem Aridaeum,</quote> <trans><tr>rejected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 11</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: terra numquam recusat imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua impediunt cursumque recusant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapax ignis non umquam alimenta recusat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(falsae gemmae) recusant limae probationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n40685.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (in class. prose, only in negative sentences or questions implying a negative): <cit><quote lang="la">mori recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 17, 2</bibl>; Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad minora se demittere, Quint. prooem. § 5: prodere voce suā quemquam aut opponere morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptis parere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam tentare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi comes ire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>. 704: <cit><quote lang="la">facere ipse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 208</bibl></cit>; Plin. <pb n="1538" /> <cb n="REDA" /> Pan. 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 1, 6</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: pedes vitiosum ferre recusant Corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 108</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 259</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40685.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non rem (medicam) antiqui damnabant, sed artem. Maxime vero quaestum esse manipretio vitae recusabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Velinum lacum obstrui recusantes,</quote> <trans><tr>refusing to permit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, II.—</sense><sense id="n40685.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de judiciis transferendis recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servilius et recusare et deprecari, ne iniquis judicibus ... judicium capitis in se constitueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam ne diceret, recusavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui ... ne unus omnes antecederet, recusarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si absim, haud recusem, quin mihi male sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possumus, quin alii a nobis dissentiant, recusare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recuso quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque recusare ... quin armis contendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 19</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec recusabo, quominus omnes mea legant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">... quominus perpetuo sub illorum dicione essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque recusavit quo minus poenam subiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recuso, non abnuo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recusandi aut deprecandi causā legatos mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 29</bibl> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n40685.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40685.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disprove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nativitatis mendacium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40685.8" n="2" level="3"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">to protest</hi> against a complaint; <hi rend="ital">to object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take exception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plead in defence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa omnis, in quā pars altera agentis est, altera recusantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid recusas contra me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu me ad verbum vocas: non ante venio, quam recusaro ... Quoniam satis recusavi, veniam jam quo vocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:28:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 28, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reus recusare vellet, sub usuris creditam esse pecuniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. recusatio, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
recussabilis: <entryFree id="n40686" type="hapax" key="re^cussa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcussābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recutio</etym>, <sense id="n40686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be struck back and forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
recussus: <entryFree id="n40687" type="main" key="re^cussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from recutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40688" type="main" key="re^cussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recutio</etym>, <sense id="n40688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebound</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>; Fulg. Myth. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
recutio: <entryFree id="n40689" type="main" key="re^cu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cŭtĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n40689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>cussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strike back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to rebound</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aequor penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:167" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 167</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jugum Christi, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 40: horrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Conf. 8:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Conf. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: uteroque recusso Insonuere cavae cavernae, <hi rend="ital">being caused to reverberate</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recussus somno,</quote> <trans><tr>aroused by shaking</tr>, <tr>startled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 170, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>, p. 153, 35.</sense></entryFree>
