recutitus: <entryFree id="n40690" type="main" key="re^cu^ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cŭtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cutis</etym>, <sense id="n40690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circumcised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:30:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68, 8</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sabbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:184" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <trans><tr>skinned</tr>, <tr>galled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:57:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 57, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reda: <entryFree id="n40691" type="main" key="re_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. raeda.</entryFree>
redaccendo: <entryFree id="n40692" type="main" key="re^daccendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-accendo</orth>, no <sense id="n40692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rekindle</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redactus: <entryFree id="n40693" type="main" key="re^dactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from redigo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40694" type="main" key="re^dactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>redigo</etym>, <sense id="n40694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proceeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuum holeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:89" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redadopto: <entryFree id="n40695" type="hapax" key="re^da^dopto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ădopto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adopt anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to readopt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redambulo: <entryFree id="n40696" type="hapax" key="re^dambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene ambula et redambula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redamo: <entryFree id="n40697" type="main" key="re^da^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ămo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to love back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return love for love</hi> (formed by Cic. after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ntifilei=n</foreign>): qui vel amare vel, ut ita dicam, redamare possit, Cic. Lae). 14, 49; <cit><quote lang="la">also in late Lat.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, § 75</bibl>; Leo M. Sern. 72; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 19, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redamtruo: <entryFree id="n40698" type="hapax" key="re^damtru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-amtrŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dance opposite</hi> in the Salian religious festivals: praesul ut amtruet, inde vulgus redamtruat, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
redanimatio: <entryFree id="n40699" type="main" key="re^da^ni^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdănĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redanimo</etym>, <sense id="n40699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="REDD" /> <hi rend="ital">restoring to life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reanimation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redanimo: <entryFree id="n40700" type="main" key="re^da^ni^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ănĭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to quicken again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore to life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reanimate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
redardesco: <entryFree id="n40701" type="main" key="re^dardesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ardesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blaze up anew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma redardescet, quae modo nulla fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 734</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redarguo: <entryFree id="n40702" type="main" key="re^dargu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-argŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contradict</hi> (class.; syn.: refello, refuto). </sense><sense id="n40702.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosque ipsos redargui refellique patiamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 23, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:73 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 73 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 293</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orationem (opp. convinci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famosos libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 55</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of abstr. subjects: improborum prosperitates redarguunt vim omnem deorum ac potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstantiam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: advenit qui vestra dies muliebribus armis Verba redarguerit, <hi rend="ital">will refute thy words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show them to be false</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 687</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n40702.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi rationem falsam quidem, sed quam redarguere falsam esse tu non queas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40702.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to convict of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove guilty of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sane magnum aliquid efficiemus, quod illos ignorantiae redarguemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redarguti a lege quasi transgressores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 2, 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40702.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: poterat autem inpune; <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim redargueret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redargutio: <entryFree id="n40703" type="main" key="re^dargu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdargūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redarguo</etym>, <sense id="n40703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refutation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habens in ore suo refutationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 37, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in redargutionem venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall into contempt</tr>, <tr>be mocked at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 19, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 37, 15</bibl>; Boëth. Arist. Elench. 1 pr.</sense></entryFree>
redarius: <entryFree id="n40704" type="main" key="re_da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēdārĭus</orth>, v. raedarius.</entryFree>
redarmatus: <entryFree id="n40705" type="hapax" key="re^darma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-armātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [armo], <sense id="n40705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rearmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus novis jaculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redauspico: <entryFree id="n40706" type="hapax" key="re^dauspi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-auspĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take the auspices anew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exauspicavi ex vinclis: nunc intellego Redauspicandum esse in catenas denuo, comically for,</quote> <trans><tr>to go back again</tr>, <tr>return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 108</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
redditio: <entryFree id="n40707" type="main" key="reddi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reddĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reddo</etym>, <sense id="n40707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">returning.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40707.1" n="I" level="1"> Jucunditatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 1, 29</bibl>: rationis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rendering a reason</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 7.— </sense><sense id="n40707.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A repetition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recurrence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 533</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40707.3" n="III" level="1"> Rhet. t. t., Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)po/dosis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the consequent clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the apodosis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:79" default="NO">79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:80" default="NO">80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
redditivus: <entryFree id="n40708" type="main" key="reddi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reddĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>redditio, III.</etym>, <sense id="n40708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the apodosis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequential</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redditive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <trans><tr>the apodosis</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">particulae, e. g. talis, ita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1052</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
redditor: <entryFree id="n40709" type="main" key="reddi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reddĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reddo</etym>, <sense id="n40709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a payer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redditus: <entryFree id="n40710" type="main" key="reddi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reddĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from reddo.</entryFree>
reddo: <entryFree id="n40711" type="main" key="reddo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">red-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n40711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> reddibo = reddam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 49</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 476, 27</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 9</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> reddibitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 22</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40711.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. restituo): reddere est quod debeas ei cujus est volenti dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi pallam reddat, quam dudum dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">potes nunc mutuam drachmam dare mihi unam, quam cras reddam tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so corresp. to dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si reddatur illi, unde empta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 24 sq.</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the foll.: ea, quae utenda acceperis, majore mensurā, si modo possis, jubet reddere Hesiodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so corresp. to accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe quod nunquam reddas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 450</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ab omnibus conceditur, id reddo ac remitto,</quote> <trans><tr>I give it back and renounce it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Redde argentum aut virginem. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quod argentum, quam tu virginem, me reposcis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (virginem) suis Restituam ac reddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alias tegulas, i. e. restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: obsides, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 19</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36</bibl>; <cb n="REDD" /> 6, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ho mines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora (mor tuorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum cuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatem mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive paribus paria redduntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are set against</tr>, <tr>opposed to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmet ipsos nobis reddidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redditus Cyri solio Phraates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddas incolumem, precor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te reddat natis carisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redditus terris Daedalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patriis aris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam urbi votisque publicis redditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex magnā desperatione saluti redditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu primum salutem reddis, quam dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam da, opera reddibitur tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 101</bibl>: cum duo genera liberalitatis sint, unum dandi beneficii, alterum reddendi, demus nec ne, in nostrā potestate est; <cit><quote lang="la">non reddere viro bono non licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redde his libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Lyciis libertatem ademit, Rhodiis reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ereptum honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 262</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipse convivio reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>betook himself again to the banquet</tr>, <tr>returned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae belua reddit se catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se reddidit astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:119" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 119</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lux terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se iterum in arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 684</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40711.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua monstra profundo Reddidit habere Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:616" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 616</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40711.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">sic modo conbibitur, modo Redditur ingens Erasinus,</quote> <trans><tr>is swallowed up ... reappears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 275</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40711.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40711.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hand over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign; to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relinquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">trado, refero): Cincius eam mihi abs te epistulam reddidit, quam tu dederas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">litteras (alicui),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras a te mihi reddidit stator tuus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium alicui pro benefactis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoccine pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia debita (along with persolvere grates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera praemia (with dare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primos honores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam alicui (for the usual referre gratiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddunt ova columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:202" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligatam Jovi dapem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o fortunata mors, quae naturae debita, pro patriā est potissimum reddita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam naturae reddendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, vitam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitum naturae morbo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die by disease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimum spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35" default="NO">2, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 87, 2: animam caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:ib. 123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 123</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animas (with moriuntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc animam, vacuas in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caute vota reddunto,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay</tr>, <tr>offer</tr>, <tr>render</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura Lari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liba deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:476" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumantia exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">graves poenas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to suffer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:386 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 386 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ego rationem reddam?</quote> <trans><tr>will render an account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. ratio: animam a pulmonibus respirare et reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give off</tr>, <tr>exhale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibiae sonum reddunt,</quote> <trans><tr>give forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:66" default="NO">66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 348</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 217</bibl> (with mugiit); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:702" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 36</bibl></cit> et saep.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to vomit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 6</bibl></cit> (just before: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem rejecit): urinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulum partu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 379</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so of parturition,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:513" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum, quem reddunt praedia,</quote> <trans><tr>yield</tr>, <tr>produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 87</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">generi nostro haec reddita est benignitas,</quote> <trans><tr>is imparted to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: nulla quies est <pb n="1539" /> <cb n="REDD" /> Reddita corporibus primis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 96</bibl>. — Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, redditum esse, in gen., = factum esse, esse: <cit><quote lang="la">una superstitio, superis quae reddita divis,</quote> <trans><tr>which is given</tr>, <tr>belongs to the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 817</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus et color et sapor una reddita sunt cum odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 681</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 228</bibl> Munro ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 93</bibl>; Orell. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque iis petentibus jus redditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is dispensed</tr>, <tr>granted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui testimonium reddere industriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquum vitae virium, id ferro potissimum reddere volebant,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield</tr>, <tr>sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ille pro meritis ... jura legesque reddiderat,</quote> <trans><tr>had conferred upon it the power of self-jurisdiction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 23</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lanuvinis sacra sua reddita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia,</quote> <trans><tr>to bestow</tr>, <tr>grant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatis veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina facto vera,</quote> <trans><tr>to call by the right name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n40711.6" n="b" level="4"> Jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint</tr>, <tr>grant</tr>, <tr>fix the time for a trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <trans><tr>to administer justice</tr>, <tr>pronounce sentence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11</bibl></cit>; 13, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 9</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n40711.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi> to one that which has not been taken away, but only threatened or in danger: <cit><quote lang="la">Thermitanis urbem, agros legesque suas reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 90</bibl></cit> ( = relinquere, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 36</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">88): Orestis leges suae redditae,</quote> <trans><tr>left undisturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 34, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 43, 23</bibl> (cf. restituere); 29, 21, 7.— </sense><sense id="n40711.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay back;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to take revenge for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict vengeance for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eum stare quominus accepta ad Cannas redderetur hosti clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddidit hosti cladem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redditaque aequa Cannensi clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 49, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40711.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give back</hi> in speech or writing, i. e. </sense><sense id="n40711.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To translate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">converto, transfero): cum ea, quae legeram Graece, Latine redderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum pro verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 54</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40711.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rehearse</hi> (freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae secum commentatus esset, ea sine scripto verbis iisdem redderet, quibus cogitasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive paria (verba) paribus redduntur, sive opponuntur contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere quae restant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium actum de pastionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina per ordinem audita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas corruptae eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cuique vendidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictata,</quote> <trans><tr>to repeat</tr>, <tr>rehearse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>to recite</tr>, <tr>deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum talia reddidit hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 330</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:F. 1:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne exemplum suo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40711.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">veras audire et reddere voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 409</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 689</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas contra cui talia reddit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 530</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 323: auditis ille haec placido sic reddidit ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 251</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 672</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40711.13" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">render</hi> a thing according to its nature or qualities; <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemble</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quas hominum reddunt facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 752</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux aemula vultum Reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>gave back</tr>, <tr>reflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:634" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et qui te nomine reddet Silvius Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 768</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Phoebe toto fratrem cum redderet orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternam elegantiam in loquendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:107" default="NO">6, 3, 107</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem croci saporemque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to smell and taste like saffron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem quandam uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam excellentis purpurae et odorem maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 27, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apelleā redditus arte Mentor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:10:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40711.14" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> a thing changed in some respect: <cit><quote lang="la">senem illum Tibi dedo ulteriorem lepide ut lenitum reddas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tu sapienter mihi reddidisti opiparas opera tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, in gen., </sense><sense id="n40711.15" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> something or somehow; <hi rend="ital">to render</hi> (very freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facio, redigo): reddam ego te ex ferā fame mansuetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (servitutem) lenem reddere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: tutiorem et opulentiorem vitam <cb n="REDE" /> reddere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec itinera infesta reddiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem insignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscuraque moto Reddita forma lacu est,</quote> <trans><tr>dimmed by the disturbance of the water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ex feris et immanibus mites reddidit et mansuetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: omnes Catilinas Acidinos postea reddidit, <hi rend="ital">has made all the Catilines seem to be Acidini</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">patriots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in comparison with himself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid perfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid effectum,</quote> <trans><tr>to accomplish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne transactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum ac factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic reddes omnia Quae sunt certa ei consilia incerta ut sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> = fieri scripsit fasciculum illum epistularum totum sibi aquā madidum redditum esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:7:2" default="NO">22, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sudorem corpus tantum imbecillius redditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:4" default="NO">42, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:10" default="NO">44, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3</bibl> prooem.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redemptio: <entryFree id="n40712" type="main" key="re^dempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdemptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redimo</etym>. <sense id="n40712.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A buying back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buying off; a releasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ransoming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redemption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum captivis redemptio negabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis (capti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: sacramenti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the purchase of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s military oath</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of his discharge</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 56, 4 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:ib. 55:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 4</bibl>: qui se pecuniā redemerunt).— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quia mercede pactā accesserat ad talem redemptionem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a releasing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">release of the debtor from the demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by paying the creditor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; v. redemptor.—</sense><sense id="n40712.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A buying up</hi> of a court of justice, <hi rend="ital">bribing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reorum pactiones, redemptiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40712.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A farming</hi> of the revenue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40712.3" n="IV" level="1"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a release from sin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from its penalties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rescuing from death</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">animae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 48, 8</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redemptito: <entryFree id="n40713" type="main" key="re^dempti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdemptĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>redempto</etym>, <sense id="n40713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buy up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redeem</hi>: malefacta benefactis, <hi rend="ital">to compensate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make amends for</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
redempto: <entryFree id="n40714" type="hapax" key="re^dempto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdempto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>redimo</etym>, <sense id="n40714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buy back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ransom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redeem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(captivi) a propinquis redemptabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redemptor: <entryFree id="n40715" type="main" key="re^demptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdemptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40715.0" n="I" level="1"> In all periods of the lang., <hi rend="ital">one who undertakes a thing by way of contract; a contractor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purveyor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farmer</hi> (syn. conductor); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptor qui columnam illam de Cottā et de Torquato conduxerat faciendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 107</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptori tuo dimidium pecuniae curavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 72</bibl> et saep.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelae Capitolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontis,</quote> <trans><tr>one who farmed the tolls of a bridge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:5:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 5, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll., and Becker, Antiq. 2, 1, p. 270 and 3, 2, p. 217.— </sense><sense id="n40715.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat.: redemptor litis. </sense><sense id="n40715.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">One who releases a debtor from a demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by paying his creditor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40715.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">One who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertakes the risk of a suit</hi> (freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40715.4" n="III" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the Redeemer</hi> (of the world from sin), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 130:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 130, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 19, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 7, 35</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
redemptrix: <entryFree id="n40716" type="main" key="re^demptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdemptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redemptor, II.</etym>, <sense id="n40716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that redeems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a redemptress</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 77, 3; Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:297" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 297</bibl>; Am. bros. de Caïn et Abel, 2, 4, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:de Vid. 6:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Vid. 6, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redemptura: <entryFree id="n40717" type="main" key="re^demptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdemptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redimo</etym>, <sense id="n40717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an undertaking of public deliverings by contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contracting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farming</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui redempturis auxissent patrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redempturis faciendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 2, 1, p. 270, and 3, 2, p. 217.</sense></entryFree>
redemptus: <entryFree id="n40718" type="main" key="re^demptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdemptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from redimo.</entryFree>
redeo: <entryFree id="n40719" type="main" key="re^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ĭtum, īre</itype> (lengthened form of the <sense id="n40719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> redīnunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286</bibl> Müll.; cf.: obinunt, ferinunt, nequinunt, solinunt, for obeunt, feriunt, nequeunt, solent; and danit, danunt, for dat, dant; rare <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> redies, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, 19</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 25, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 37, 7</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <cb n="REDE" /> </sense><sense id="n40719.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come back; to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn around</hi> (freq. and class.; syn revertor). </sense><sense id="n40719.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40719.3" n="1" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n40719.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene re gestā salvus redeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velletne me redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et non nisi revocaretis, rediturus fuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">erus alter ex Alide rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illis contionibus domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">a portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a portā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a foro do mum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab re divinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a cenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Caesare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Africā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 588</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n40719.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cariā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 5</bibl>; 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opsonatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbanā aede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:785" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 785</bibl></cit>. — (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:455" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc, inde, unde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11, 7 al.</bibl> — (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adv. of time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum rediturum actutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua haud tarde redientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:520" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mature,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 794</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatum rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">joined with retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:794 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 794 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veram in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in rectam semitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in the same sense, simply in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>to renew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serus in caelum redeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gyrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 784</bibl></cit> et saep. — (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad parentes denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: ad castra, Auct. B. Hisp. 25; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se rediturum ad penates et in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 37</bibl></cit>: Romam <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:455" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cirtam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Babyloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">his laeti rediere duces loca amoena piorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:703" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 703</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adv. of direction</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc, illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 53 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 261</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc. of distance</hi>: ite viam, Vet. Form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itque reditque viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 122</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stas, reditum oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arbitrum reditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manerent indutiae, dum ab illo rediri posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Romam reditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">n</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe redit patrios ascendere perdita muros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 171</bibl></cit>: hirundo reditura cibos immittere nidis, Montan. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.8" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">astra ad idem, unde profecta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sol in sua signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:161" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem redeuntia solis Lumina viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeuntis cornua lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:479" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverso redierunt carbasa vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus reditura vela tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen in eandem partem, ex quā venerat, redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
