C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes In fontes suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille qui in se redit orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeunt jam gramina campis Arboribusque comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arboribus frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:237" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 237</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspersisti aquam, Jam rediit animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mens et rediit verus in ora color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus et vita redit bonis ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum redit ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redit animo ille latus clavus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: in pristinum <pb n="1540" /> <cb n="REDE" /> statum, Gaes. B. G. 7, 54: <cit><quote lang="la">in statum antiquum rediit res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum in vestram dicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Alcumenā antiquam in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suis inimicissimis in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 1</bibl>; cf.: se numquam cum matre in gratiam redisse, <hi rend="ital">had never been reconciled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had never been at variance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 17, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 40</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fidem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc demum in memoriam redeo,</quote> <trans><tr>I recollect</tr>, <tr>call to mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 57</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in corda redeunt tumultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere calor redit ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redit agricolis labor actus in orbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursum ad ingenium redit,</quote> <trans><tr>he returns to his natural bent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se atque ad mores suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; but redire ad se signifies also, <hi rend="ital">to come to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to recover one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s senses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 138</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex somno vix ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1023" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1023</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec discussis redeunt erroribus ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:996" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 996</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: reverto: in veram rediit faciem solitumque nitorem, <hi rend="ital">returned to his true form</hi> (of Apollo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 231</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in annos Quos egit, rediit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he resumed his youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:430" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 430</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">reformatus primos in annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 399</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">in juvenem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:766" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fastos,</quote> <trans><tr>to go back to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis redeant in aurum Tempora priscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causas malorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to appear again as the cause of misfortunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturos iterum est questa redire dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit> (3, 10), 12; <cit><quote lang="la">so of times and events which recur periodically: annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne rediret Saeculum Pyrrhae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonae Decembres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum sollemnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 1 al.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum exuto justitio reditum ad munia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in speaking, thinking, or writing. </sense><sense id="n40719.11" n="a" level="4"> Of the speaker, <hi rend="ital">to go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> to a former subject, <hi rend="ital">to recur</hi> to it: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte ista, atque ad rem redi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 31 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si redeo ad illos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed de hoc alias: nunc redeo ad augurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad Scipionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fabulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illa prima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ad illum redeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc, unde abii, redeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius evectus sum, sed redeo ad propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">digredi a re et redire ad propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illo impetu ad rationem redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 28</bibl></cit> et saep. —Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in Epidamnum pedibus redeundum'st mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.12" n="b" level="4"> Of the subject: <cit><quote lang="la">res redit,</quote> <trans><tr>comes up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redit de integro haec oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40719.13" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of <hi rend="ital">ire</hi> predominating; cf.: recido, redigo). </sense><sense id="n40719.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come in</hi> as revenue, income; <hi rend="ital">to arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (cf. provenio): <cit><quote lang="la">tribus tantis illi minus redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex eodem semine aliubi cum decimo redeat, aliubi cum quintodecimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possentne fructus pro impensā ac labore redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pecore redeunt ter ducena Parmensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:37:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia publica, quae ex metallis redibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā regione quinquaginta talenta quotannis redibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e modio redire sextarios quattuor siliginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:89" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 20, § 89</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n40719.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be brought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reduced to; to arrive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi> a thing; constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">ad;</hi> very rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilis omissis ad gladios redierunt,</quote> <trans><tr>betook themselves to their swords</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad manus reditur, Auct. B. Afr. 18, 4: Caesar opinione trium legionum dejectus, ad duas redierat,</quote> <trans><tr>was brought down</tr>, <tr>reduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 48 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: collis leniter fastigatus paulatim ad planitiem redibat, <hi rend="ital">sank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sloped down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descended</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl>: ejus morte ea ad me lege redierunt bona, <cb n="REDI" /> <hi rend="ital">have descended to me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad hos lege hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (principum) ad arbitrium judiciumque summa omnium rerum consiliorumque redeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa imperii, rerum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad interregnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ad rastros res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 58</bibl></cit> (with redigat ad inopiam): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad pauca redeam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cut the story short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 43</bibl>: aut haec bona in tabulas publicas nulla redierunt, aut si redierunt, etc., <hi rend="ital">have not reached</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">are not registered upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germania in septentrionem ingenti flexu redit,</quote> <trans><tr>trends towards the north</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum res rediit jam locum, Ut sit necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nubem Ossa redit,</quote> <trans><tr>rises to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus, quam penes amantūm summa summarum redit,</quote> <trans><tr>falls to her lot</tr>, <tr>pertains to her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si eo meae fortunae redeunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>come to that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adeo res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia verba huc redeunt,</quote> <trans><tr>come to</tr>, <tr>amount to this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoditas huc omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redhalo: <entryFree id="n40720" type="hapax" key="re^dha_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-hālo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to breathe forth again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 523</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redhibeo: <entryFree id="n40721" type="main" key="re^dhi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-hĭbĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕt-hĭb-</orth>), no <sense id="n40721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>habeo</etym>, mercant. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to take back</hi> a defective article purchased; hence, of the buyer, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give back;</hi> of the seller, <hi rend="ital">to receive back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redhibere est facere, ut rursus habeat venditor, quod habuerat, et quia reddendo id fiebat, idcirco redhibitio est appellata quasi redditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the whole chapter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>, De redhibitione, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si malae emptae Forent, nobis istas redhibere haud liceret,</quote> <trans><tr>to give back</tr>, <tr>return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in mancipio vendendo dicendane vitia, quae nisi dixeris, redhibeatur mancipium jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">(eunuchum) redhiberi posse quasi morbosum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(servus) redhibitus ob aliquod vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: dixit (sc. venditor) se (ancillam) redhibere, si non placeat, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 87</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 49</bibl>, the correct read. is reddibo; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
redhibitio: <entryFree id="n40722" type="main" key="re^dhi^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdhĭbĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕthĭb-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redhibeo</etym>, <sense id="n40722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a giving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receiving back</hi> a damaged article sold, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:21 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:25" default="NO">44, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in causā redhibitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam retroacta venditio esset redhibitioni similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redhibitor: <entryFree id="n40723" type="gloss" key="re^dhi^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdhĭbĭtor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 58" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 58</bibl>, Serm. 2, 1: <foreign lang="greek">a)na/doxos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
redhibitorius: <entryFree id="n40724" type="main" key="re^dhi^bi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdhĭbĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>redhibeo</etym>, in jurid. Lat., <sense id="n40724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to taking back</hi> a thing sold: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:48" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redhostio: <entryFree id="n40725" type="main" key="re^dhosti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-hostĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requite</hi>, Nov. and Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 165, 20 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
redico: <entryFree id="n40726" type="hapax" key="re^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-dīco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to say again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rediculus: <entryFree id="n40727" type="main" key="Re^di^cu^lu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕdĭcŭlŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>redeo</etym>, <sense id="n40727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman divinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipped in a chapel at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before the</hi> porta Capena, <hi rend="ital">whence Hannibal set out upon his retreat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=282:23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 282, 23</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=283:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 283, 4</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">Campus Rediculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 12</bibl></cit>; v. Tutanus.</sense></entryFree>
redigo: <entryFree id="n40728" type="main" key="re^di^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>. <sense id="n40728.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi> (syn. reduco). </sense><sense id="n40728.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sol) Disjectos redegit equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si materiem nostram collegerit aetas Post obitum, rursumque redegerit, ut sita nunc est,</quote> <trans><tr>bring it back</tr>, <tr>restore it to its present condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 848</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia parva duas redigebat rupe capellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:511" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros in gregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sua rura boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani (hostem) fusum fugatumque in castra redigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium equitatum in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbam ferro in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Capuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40728.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad pristinam belli rationem redegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum neglegentia conturbatum ad pristinam rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam militarem ad priscos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: aliquid ad ultimam sui generis formam <cb n="REDI" /> speciemque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia redegit in singulas rationes praeceptionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, qui ais, redige in memoriam,</quote> <trans><tr>recall it to my mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(poëtae) formidine fustis Ad bene dicendum delectandumque redacti,</quote> <trans><tr>brought back</tr>, <tr>reduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 155</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq.,</sense><sense id="n40728.3" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of agere predominant; cf. recido and redeo, II.) <hi rend="ital">To get together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> a sum of money or the like by selling, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnem pecuniam ex aerario exhausissetis, ex vectigalibus redegissetis, ab omnibus regibus coëgissetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex bonis patriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:69" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne argentum tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>to scrape together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona vendit, pecuniam redigit ... pecunia, quam ex Agonidis bonis redegisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnis frumenti copia decumarum nomine penes istum esset redacta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:73:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 73, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:5:section=22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 4, 5, § 22</bibl></cit> (after colere agros); 22, 1, 46; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars maxima (praedae) ad quaestorem redacta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus ad eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:51" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid captum ex hostibus est, vendidit Fabius, consul, ac redegit in publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>paid it into the public treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditum sub hastā in aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(patres) victi irā vetuere reddi (bona regia), vetuere in publicum redigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam in fiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40728.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi> a thing to any condition, circumstance, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">render</hi> it so and so (cf. reddo); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (so most freq.), <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>, an <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with a double <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n40728.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduos in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristinam sortem servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidulum in potestatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem in potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:45" default="NO">45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 55, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:94:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 94, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem in dicionem potestatemque populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos in dicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes in dicionem hujus imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arvernos in provinciam,</quote> <trans><tr>to reduce to a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 77</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem Britanniae, etc., in formam provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:93" default="NO" valid="yes">93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in formulam provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:38:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in formam praefecturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id redactus sum loci, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">republicā in tranquillum redactā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem in veros timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc genus (pecuniarum) in unum redigatur,</quote> <trans><tr>be brought into one mass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositio est, per quam illa, quae invenimus, in ordinem redigimus,</quote> <trans><tr>reduce to order</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores in ordinem certaque intervalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; but: ut veteres grammatici auctores alios in ordinem redegerint, alios omnino exemerint numero, <hi rend="ital">brought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admitted into the rank of classics</hi> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)gkri/nein;</foreign> opp. numero eximere = <foreign lang="greek">e)kkri/nein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">libertinos in equestrem ordinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: redigere aliquem (poëtam) in numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>to lower</tr>, <tr>degrade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 15</bibl></cit>; v. ordo; cf. Liv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1173</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod prosa scriptum redigere in quaedam versiculorum genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hanc consuetudinem memoriā exercitatione redigendā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos, in dominium nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nihilum redigam te, et non eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 26, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cinerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 6: provinciam in solitudinem, Lact. de Ira Dei, 5, 4.— </sense><sense id="n40728.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad inopiam redigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to reduce to poverty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad incitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus id ad interitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 877</bibl></cit>; Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 11, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prope ad internecionem gente ac nomine Nerviorum redacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nihilum redigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:72:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 72, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam ad vanum et irritum,</quote> <trans><tr>to render empty and useless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: cf.: <pb n="1541" /> <cb n="REDI" /> spem ad irritum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ante dubium ad certum,</quote> <trans><tr>to render certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes excrescentes ad aequalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 113</bibl></cit> (shortly afterwards reducunt); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices ad planum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad desperationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 5, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">redegit se ad pallium et crepidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40728.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam sub populi Romani imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corcyram sub imperium Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaros sub jus dicionemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolas ejus insulae sub potestatem Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pelop. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Italiam sub se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Flor. 1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Flor. 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">GENTES SVB IMPERIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40728.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo redigis me, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hem! Quo redactus sum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ut credam, redigunt animum mihi argumenta, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 10</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 516 Rib.): ut ejus animum retundam, redigam, ut, quo se vortat, nesciat, <hi rend="ital">bring it down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 553</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With double <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">render</hi> a thing something (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq. reddere): quae facilia ex difficillimis animi magnitudo redegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ubios) Suevi multo humiliores infirmioresque redegerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 224</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40728.9" n="2" level="3"> In designations of number, etc., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to bring within</hi> a number or extent; <hi rend="ital">to lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam jam ad paucos redactam paene ab interitu vindicasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redigere omnis fere in quadrum numerumque sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 61, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosce ipsos (libros octo) utiliter ad sex libros redegit Diophanes,</quote> <trans><tr>reduced</tr>, <tr>abridged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hominum milibus LX. vix ad D.... sese redactos esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad semuncias redacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia ad duo genera judicum redegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ad numerum redigar duorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si comminuas vilem redigatur ad assem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne res ad nilum redigantur funditus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 791</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:752" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 752</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem maximam redigere ad minimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redimiae: <entryFree id="n40729" type="gloss" key="re^di^mi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭmĭae</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">xu/tra,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. [redimo].</entryFree>
redimiculat: <entryFree id="n40730" type="main" key="re^di^mi_cu^lat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭmīcŭlat</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)nalu/ei de/smata,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. [redimiculum].</entryFree>
redimiculum: <entryFree id="n40731" type="main" key="re^di^mi_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭmīcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭ-mīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, late Lat., <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 5</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>redimio</etym>, <sense id="n40731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40731.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40731.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fillet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necklace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frontlet</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habent redimicula mitrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 616</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui longa domi redimicula sumunt frontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:84 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 84 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">redimicula sunt quibus mitra adligatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40731.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A girdle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redimiculum est, quod succinctorium sive bracile nominamus, quod descendens per cervicem et a lateribus colli divisum utrarumque alarum sinus ambit atque hinc inde succingit, etc. Hunc vulgo brachilem quasi brachialem dicunt, quamvis nunc non bracchiorum sed renum sit cingulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 33, 5</bibl></cit>.— *</sense><sense id="n40731.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redimio: <entryFree id="n40732" type="main" key="re^di^mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭmĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n40732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> redimibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 538</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 94</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bind round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreathe round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crown</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: cingo, circumdo). </sense><sense id="n40732.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput atque umeros plexis redimire coronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tempora vittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitrā capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem corymbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelyn,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:70:5 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 70, 5 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sertis redimiri jubebis et rosā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauro tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigium aedis tintinnabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91</bibl></cit>: hortum floribus, Col. poët. 10, 286. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sic innumeros arcu mutante colores Incipiens redimitur hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>is girt round</tr>, <tr>environed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40732.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sertis redimiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redimitus coronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguineo redimita capillo Frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons corymbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons regium in morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus floridis corollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia variarum coronarum genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 87</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.: loca silvis, <hi rend="ital">girt</hi> <cb n="REDI" /> <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Naxos Aegaeo ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 487" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 487</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">missile,</quote> <trans><tr>the wreathed thyrsus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 246</bibl></cit>.— In a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> construction: <cit><quote lang="la">redimitus tempora lauro, quercu, mitrā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 654</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:269" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 269</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">669</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 661</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput harundine redimitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 2 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
redimitus: <entryFree id="n40733" type="hapax" key="re^di^mi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭmītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>redimio</etym>, <sense id="n40733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wreathing round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crowning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redimo: <entryFree id="n40734" type="main" key="re^di^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ĭmo</orth>, <itype>ēmi, emptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>emo</etym>. <sense id="n40734.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To buy back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repurchase</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: recupero, reparo). </sense><sense id="n40734.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (domum) non minoris, quam emit Antonius, redimet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque adeo hasce emi mihi — illi redemi rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut emendum sibi quod non habebat, aut redimendum quod habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fundo redimendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orabo, ut mihi pallam reddat, quam dudum dedi, Aliam illi redimam meliorem,</quote> <trans><tr>will buy in return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 162</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40734.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to buy back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ransom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redeem</hi> a prisoner, slave, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Tu redimes me, si me hostes interceperint? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Redimam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is homo redimatur illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captos, captivos ab hoste, a praedonibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 90</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec benignitas, redimi e servitute captos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi in publicum redempti ac manumissi,</quote> <trans><tr>ransomed</tr>, <tr>liberated at public cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me raptum pugnā pretiove redemptum Mandere humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 63</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n40734.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to buy off</hi> from any thing; <hi rend="ital">to set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a piratis publicā civitatium pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā se a judicibus, palam redemerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab inquisitoribus pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a Gallis auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a cane,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab invidiā fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suo sanguine ab Acheronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem Pollux alternā morte redemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (sc. a morbo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redimite armis civitatem, quam auro majores vestri redemerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:15:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 34, 5</bibl>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">redemit Dominus Jacob,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 31, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 1, 18 et saep. — </sense><sense id="n40734.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To buy up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40734.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40734.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">statim redemi fundos omnes, qui patroni mei fuerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedum sumptuose fabricatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros suppressos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40734.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to hire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditores conducti et redempti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plausor redemptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor aut curator redemptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemuli corrupti ac redempti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 54</bibl></cit>.— More freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n40734.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., a mercant. and jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">undertake by contract; to hire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farm</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dumnorigem portoria reliquaque omnia Aeduorum vectigalia parvo pretio redempta habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 92</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">picarias de censoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum eripiendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">31: vestimenta texenda vel insulam, vel navem fabricandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <trans><tr>to undertake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.— Esp., in law, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to undertake the risk of a suit for a consideration</hi> (which was held dishonorable; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to the authorized stipulation of a fee): litem te redemisse contra bonos mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: redimit eventum litium majoris pecuniae praemio contra bonos mores (procurator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui alios actionum suarum redimunt exactores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who engage persons to undertake their suits in their own names</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>; cf., respecting redimere litem, Mühlenbruch, Die Lehre von der Cession, p. 362 sq.—</sense><sense id="n40734.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40734.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi> any thing desirable: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab eo (praetore) servorum sceleris conjurationisque damnatorum vita vel ipso carnifice internuncio redimeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vitam omnium civium ... quinque hominum amentium ac perditorum poenā redemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: non vitam liberum sed mortis celeritatem <cb n="REDI" /> pretio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepeliendi potestatem pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem sibi sempiternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem Ariovisti ne obsidibus quidem datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium gratiam atque amicitiam ejus morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum voluntates largitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo tantummodo belli moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve auro redimat jus triste sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuam dissimulationem mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid homines vel vitā aestimant vel morte redimunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:3" default="NO">5, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40734.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To buy off</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avert</hi> an evil: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (acerbitatem) ego a re publicā meis privatis et domesticis incommodis libentissime redemissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vero, quae vel vitā redimi recte possunt, aestimare pecuniā non queo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se uno quaestu decumarum omnia sua pericula redempturum esse dicebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">49: metum virgarum pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 44</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">117: ignominiam assiduo labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:21" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ab Illyriis pactā mercede redimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:1" default="NO">7, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:5" default="NO">7, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mea mors redimenda tuā esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te pugnantem tua forma redemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui delatorem redemit,</quote> <trans><tr>has bought off</tr>, <tr>hushed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40734.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pay for; to make amends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compensate for</hi> a wrong: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium aut facinus redimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa desidiae crimina morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 87</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam congiario culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:28:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 28, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. simply culpam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium auctore (sc. Jove),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua perjuria per nostram poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40734.13" n="4" level="3"> Of one's word or promise, <hi rend="ital">to redeem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:36:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 36, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redindutus: <entryFree id="n40735" type="hapax" key="re^dindu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-indūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [induo], <sense id="n40735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has put on again</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">clothed again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reclothed with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">redindutus carnem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
redintegratio: <entryFree id="n40736" type="main" key="re^dintegra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdintegrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redintegro</etym>, <sense id="n40736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repetition</hi> (mostly post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 68, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis et virium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem verbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 28, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redintegrator: <entryFree id="n40737" type="main" key="re^dintegra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdintegrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">OPERVM PVBLICORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium (somnus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redintegro: <entryFree id="n40738" type="main" key="re^dinte^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-intĕgro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make whole again; to restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew; to recruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi> (good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: renovo, restauro, recreo): vide, quantis imbribus repente dejectis (di) solum molliant venasque fontium arentes redintegrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam (with renovare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut renovetur, non redintegretur oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>be not repeated word for word</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretatio est, quae non idem redintegrat verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 28, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut deminutae copiae redintegrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluto matrimonio ... redintegrato rursus matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redintegratis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl>; 2, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:8:13 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 8, 13 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 25</bibl></cit>: bellum alicui, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissensionem civilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
