G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(columbae fastidientes) libero aëre redintegrentur,</quote> <trans><tr>are recruited</tr>, <tr>refreshed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legentium animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum tum jucunditas in herbā redintegrabit (sc. pecus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redinunt: <entryFree id="n40739" type="main" key="re^di_nunt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdīnunt</orth>, v. redeo, <sense id="n40739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
redinvenio: <entryFree id="n40740" type="hapax" key="re^dinve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-invĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to find again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam auream,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redipiscor: <entryFree id="n40741" type="hapax" key="re^di^piscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ĭpiscor</orth>, <itype>ci</itype>, <sense id="n40741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [apiscor], <hi rend="ital">to get again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">condalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redisco: <entryFree id="n40742" type="hapax" key="re^disco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-disco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn again</hi>: Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:122" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rediscussio: <entryFree id="n40743" type="main" key="re^discussio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-discussio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repeated examination</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Naum. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reditio: <entryFree id="n40744" type="main" key="re^di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redeo</etym>, <sense id="n40744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coming back; a returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (very <pb n="1542" /> <cb n="REDO" /> rare; more freq. reditus): quid illi reditio etiam huc fuit? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 30</bibl>; so, huc, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 4</bibl>: spe domum reditionis sublatā, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>: reditionis spem habere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas reditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reditus: <entryFree id="n40745" type="main" key="re^di^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>redeo</etym>. <sense id="n40745.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n40745.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster itus, reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: reditu (<hi rend="ital">returning</hi>) vel potius reversione (<hi rend="ital">turning back</hi>) meā laetatus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter profectionem reditumque L. Sullae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 63, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem reditu arcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe omni reditūs incisā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis reditu interclusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 20, 5: excludi reditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne metum reditūs sui barbaris tolleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturum reditum pollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde tibi reditum Parcae Rupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascitur in vestrum reditum votiva juvenca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum pro reditu simulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vero Narbone reditus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis reditum in caelum patere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 23, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus in patriam ad parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:436 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 436 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <trans><tr>home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 47</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittere inanes reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patent reditus populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:279 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 279 al.</bibl></cit>—Of the revolution of the heavenly bodies: <cit><quote lang="la">homines populariter annum tantummodo solis, id est unius astri, reditu metiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12, 12</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40745.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus in gratiam cum inimicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:24:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 24, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus ad rem ... ad propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40745.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to redeo, II. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">income</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceeds</hi> (not in Cic.; late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">also redditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: vectigalia, proventus); in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnisque ejus pecuniae reditus constabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in reditu esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to make returns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: decrescente reditu, id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 41</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl> Wolf. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redivia: <entryFree id="n40746" type="main" key="re^di^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭvĭōsus</orth>, v. reduv-.</entryFree>
redivivus: <entryFree id="n40747" type="main" key="re^di^vi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭ-vīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. re <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>. <sense id="n40747.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That lives again</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">recidivus): Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40747.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Renewed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renovated</hi>, of old building-materials used as new: <cit><quote lang="la">redivivus rudus (opp. novum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam columnam efficere ab integro novam, nullo lapide redivivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭ-vīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">old material used again</hi> in building: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi quicquam redivivi ex opere illo tolleretur ac non totum opus ex redivivis constitueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redivivum est ex vetusto renovatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
redo: <entryFree id="n40748" type="main" key="re_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish without bones</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redoleo: <entryFree id="n40749" type="main" key="re^do^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n40749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to emit a scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse an odor; to smell of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be redolent of</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n40749.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40749.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum redolens,</quote> <trans><tr>smelling of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa tuas redolent medicamina mensas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 355</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 213</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foetorem acoremve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:59" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40749.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes redolentes antiquitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinam exercitationemque paene puerilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem paternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 47</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40749.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40749.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fracta magis redolere videntur Omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 696</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 393</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patulis redolentia mala canistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:675" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 675</bibl></cit> al.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila Tarentini redolentia porri edisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 18, 1</bibl></cit>. — With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">redolent thymo fragrantia mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella thymi redolentia flore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40749.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quidem ex illius orationibus redolere ipsae Athenae videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: praefectus urbis, <cb n="REDU" /> cui nescio quid redoluerat, a conventu se abstinuit, <hi rend="ital">who had got scent of something</hi>, Capitol. Gord. II.</sense></entryFree>
redomitus: <entryFree id="n40750" type="hapax" key="re^do^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-dŏmĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [domo], <sense id="n40750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">retamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broken in again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives redomiti atque victi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>, v. Halm ad h. 1.</sense></entryFree>
redonator: <entryFree id="n40751" type="gloss" key="re^do_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdōnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>redono</etym>, <sense id="n40751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restorer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redones: <entryFree id="n40752" type="main" key="Re_do^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēdŏnes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhēdŏnes</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Gallia Lugdunensis near the modern Rennes in Brittany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 75, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redono: <entryFree id="n40753" type="main" key="re^do_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-dōno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (only in Hor.). * </sense><sense id="n40753.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te redonavit dis patriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40753.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves Iras et invisum nepotem Marti redonabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redoperio: <entryFree id="n40754" type="main" key="re^do^pe^rio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ŏpĕrio</orth>, <itype>ĕrui, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wrap up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover again</hi>, Ambros. de Noë et Arcā, 20, 72.</sense></entryFree>
redopto: <entryFree id="n40755" type="hapax" key="re^dopto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-opto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wish for again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
redordior: <entryFree id="n40756" type="main" key="re^dordior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ordior</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <sense id="n40756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unravel</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">redordiri fila, rursusque texere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:76" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 22, 26, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redormio: <entryFree id="n40757" type="main" key="re^dormio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-dormio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sleep again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 36, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
redormitio: <entryFree id="n40758" type="hapax" key="re^dormi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdormītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dormito</etym>, <sense id="n40758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repeated sleeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a falling asleep again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in redormitione vana esse visa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 75, 98, § 211</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redorno: <entryFree id="n40759" type="hapax" key="re^dorno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-orno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adorn again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to readorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">specula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reduco: <entryFree id="n40760" type="main" key="re^du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (rēduco or redduco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:992" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 992</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 133</bibl>; old <sense id="n40760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> redduce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 29</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n40760.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conduct back</hi> (very freq. and class.; syn. redigo). </sense><sense id="n40760.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40760.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n40760.4" n="a" level="4"> Of living objects: <cit><quote lang="la">reducam te ubi fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ex Alide huc reducimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex errore in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios a morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silenium ad parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 38</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a pastu vitulos ad tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reduci in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducere uxorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take again to wife</tr>, <tr>marry again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 51</bibl>; 4, 4, 12 sq. al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem,</quote> <trans><tr>to restore to the throne</tr>, <tr>to reinstate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 3</bibl> (v. reductio): <cit><quote lang="la">possum excitare multos reductos testes liberalitatis tuae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who have been brought back by your generosity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: cum in Italiam reductus existimabor, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18, 4</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40760.5" n="b" level="4"> With inanimate objects, <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(falces) tormentis introrsus reducebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas munitiones ab eā fossā pedes CCCC. reduxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: calculum, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jaculando bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum dextrā usque ad lumbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pectora remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 689</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium (opp. eduxit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:990 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 990 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcillas hibernatum in tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem reducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 143</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diem (Aurora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem (Aurora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem die labente (Phoebus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 914</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum (cantus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 21 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram,</quote> <trans><tr>to make the shadow move backwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 20, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40760.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40760.7" n="a" level="4"> Reducere aliquem domum (opp. deducere), <hi rend="ital">to conduct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi> one <hi rend="ital">home</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(P. Scipio) cum senatu dimisso domum reductus ad vesperum est a patribus conscriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Elea domum reducit Palma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—So, without <hi rend="ital">domum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ludum (puellulam) ducere et reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad suam villam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene comitati per forum reducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā reduci Regulus solet turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:74:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 74, 2</bibl></cit>: assurgi, deduci, <cb n="REDU" /> reduci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40760.8" n="b" level="4"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to draw off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi> troops: <cit><quote lang="la">vastatis omnibus eorum agris Caesar exercitum reduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones reduci jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum (copias, legiones suas, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:13" default="NO">2, 5, 13</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">suos incolumes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:5:13" default="NO">5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ex Britanniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a munitionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppugnatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 1, 50; 2, 9; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 34 et saep.: in hiberna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Treviros, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53</bibl></cit>; 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab radicibus collis intra munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (like duco and educo): <cit><quote lang="la">instituit reducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to march back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit> and 8.—</sense><sense id="n40760.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To recall to the stage</hi> a player: <cit><quote lang="la">a magno Pompeio magni theatri dedicatione anus pro miraculo deducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40760.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">replace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum aegrotum ad misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in gratiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gratiam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl>; cf.: ut Caesarem et Pompeium perfidiā hominum distractos rursus in pristinam concordiam reducas, Balbus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad officium sanitatemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:40:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 40, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquum ad officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices ad justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones veterem ad morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meque ipse reduco A contemplatu,</quote> <trans><tr>withdraw myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba paulum declinata ad veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatio est ad eum statum reducenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducere in memoriam quibus rationibus unam quamque partem confirmāris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam gravissimi luctūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem in animum judicantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem in quendam sonum aequabilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum facilitatem in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec benignā in sedem vice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 7 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu spem reducis mentibus anxiis Viresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 21, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem et convivia mente re duxit,</quote> <trans><tr>has recalled to mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:136" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel instituere vel reducere ejusmodi exemplum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to introduce again</tr>, <tr>restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">habitum vestitumque pristinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem transvectionis post longam intercapedinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">To bring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> to the right path: <cit><quote lang="la">scire est liberum Ingenium et animum, quo vis illos tu die Redducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40760.11" n="II" level="1"> After the Aug. period, sometimes with the idea of ducere predominating, for the usual redigere (q. v. II.). * </sense><sense id="n40760.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> a certain quantity: <cit><quote lang="la">LX. pondo panis e modio (milii) reducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40760.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi> to some shape, quality, condition, etc. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">usually redigere): aliquid in formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faecem in summum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring up</tr>, <tr>raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excrescentes carnes in ulceribus ad aequalitatem efficacissime reducunt (just before, redigit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices ad colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 82, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus sensim ad maciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 30, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera ac scabiem jumentorum ad pilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 32, § 72</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-ductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">drawn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdrawn;</hi> of place, <hi rend="ital">retired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lonely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40760.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque sinus scindit sese unda reductos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 420</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 161</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 703</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40760.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est medium vitiorum et utrimque reductum,</quote> <trans><tr>from either extreme</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 9</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In painting: alia eminentiora, alia reductiora fecerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>less prominent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: producta et reducta (bona), a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/na kai\ a)poprohgme/na</foreign> of the Stoics, <hi rend="ital">things to be preferred and those to be deferred</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 90</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
reductio: <entryFree id="n40761" type="main" key="re^ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reduco</etym>, <sense id="n40761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing back; a restoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restoration</hi> (very rare): quoniam senatūs consultum nullum exstat, quo reductio regis Alexandrini tibi adempta sit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl> (shortly afterwards: ut per te restituatur et sine multitudine reducatur): per cujus (clipei) reductiones et demissiones, <hi rend="ital">by the</hi> <pb n="1543" /> <cb n="REDU" /> <hi rend="ital">raising and lowering of which</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
reducto: <entryFree id="n40762" type="hapax" key="re^ducto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕducto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>reduco</etym>; in milit. lang., <sense id="n40762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 38" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
reductor: <entryFree id="n40763" type="main" key="re^ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brings back</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n40763.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: plebis Romanae in urbem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40763.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum jam senescentium reductor ac reformator,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>restorer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reductus: <entryFree id="n40764" type="main" key="re^ductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from reduco.</entryFree>
redulcero: <entryFree id="n40765" type="main" key="re^dulce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-ulcĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n40765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make sore again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scratch open again.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40765.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabram partem pumice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40765.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">redulceratus dolor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>renewed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reduncus: <entryFree id="n40766" type="main" key="re^duncus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd-uncus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bent backwards</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: recurvus, repandus): jamque aliis adunca, aliis redunca (cornua dedit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 125</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">curved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennis rostroque redunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora redunca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:342" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 342</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redundans: <entryFree id="n40767" type="main" key="re^dundans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdundans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from redundo.</entryFree>
redundanter: <entryFree id="n40768" type="main" key="re^dundanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdundanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. redundo, <sense id="n40768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
redundantia: <entryFree id="n40769" type="main" key="re^dundanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdundantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redundans</etym>, <sense id="n40769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n40769.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër crassus, qui non habet crebras redundantias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40769.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">redundancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess</hi>, of language, feeling, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa pro Roscio juvenilis redundantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere redundantiā et egestate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redundatio: <entryFree id="n40770" type="main" key="re^dunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>redundo</etym>, <sense id="n40770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing;</hi> hence, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <trans><tr>a rising</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:149" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 55, § 149</bibl>: astrorum, <hi rend="ital">the flowing back</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40770.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the over-abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricum tuarum redundationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
redundo: <entryFree id="n40771" type="main" key="redundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">red-undo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n40771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n.;</hi> of water, from being over full, <hi rend="ital">to run back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi> (freq. and class.; a favorite word of Cic., esp. in trop. senses; not in Cæs., Verg., or Hor.; cf.: refluo, recurro). </sense><sense id="n40771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare neque redundat unquam neque effunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lacus Albanus redundasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl>: redundantibus cloacis, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 7</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl> Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus campis redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 712</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fons campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 603</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua gutture pleno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pituita redundat aut bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locos pituitosos et quasi redundantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis in ora et oculos redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 17, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40771.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redundatus = redundans: amne redundatis fossa madebat aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:402" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 402</bibl></cit>; and for undans: (Boreae vis saeva) redundatas flumine cogit aquas, <hi rend="ital">the swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surging waters</hi> (opp. aequato siccis aquilonibus Istro), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40771.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: redundare aliquā re, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be over full of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overflow with</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n40771.4" n="1" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (crux) etiam nunc civis Romani sanguine redundat,</quote> <trans><tr>is soaked with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine hostium Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus manat cruor: ora redundant Et patulae nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 812</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40771.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">hesternā cenā redundantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40771.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flow forth in excess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superabound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redundant; to flow forth freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (Molo) dedit operam, ut nimis redundantes nos juvenili quādam dicendi impunitate et licentiā reprimeret, et quasi extra ripas diffluentes coërceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aut non compleas verbis, quod proposueris, aut redundes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Stesichorus redundat atque effunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiatici oratores parum pressi et nimis redundantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO">12, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tempus omne post consulatum objecimus iis fluctibus, qui per nos a communi peste depulsi, in nosmet ipsos redundarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod redundabit de vestro frumentario quaestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (vitiorum) ad amicos redundet infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: vitia Atheniensium in civitatem<cb n="REDU" />  nostram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex hoc beneficio nullum in me periculum redundavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, ad quos aliquantum etiam ex cottidianis sumptibus ac luxurie redundet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 23, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in genus auctoris miseri fortuna redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes, quae numero hominum ac multitudine ipsa poterant in provincias nostras redundare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec in eum annum redundarint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mur. 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod laudem adulescentis propinqui existimo etiam ad meum aliquem fructum redundare,</quote> <trans><tr>to redound</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo tuā gloriā, cujus ad me pars aliqua redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium quidem beneficiorum quae merentibus tribuuntur non ad ipsos gaudium magis quam ad similes redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 62, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi operum suorum ad se laudem, manubias ad patriam redundare maluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gloria ejus ad ipsum redundaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>, ext. 4; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 60, 2: animus per se multa desiderat, quae ad officium fructumve corporis non redundant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rerum cognitione efflorescat et redundet oportet oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>pour forth copiously</tr>, <tr>abundantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex meo tenui vectigali . . . aliquid etiam redundabit,</quote> <trans><tr>something will still remain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non reus ex eā causā redundat Postumus,</quote> <trans><tr>does not appear to be guilty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illae extraordinariae pecuniae redundarunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have flowed</tr>, <tr>proceeded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 43</bibl>, § 103: ne quid hoc parricidā civium interfecto, invidiae mihi in posteritatem redundaret, <hi rend="ital">should redound to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall upon me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 29</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n40771.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulturnus Raucis talia faucibus redundat,</quote> <trans><tr>spouts forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:71" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 71</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40771.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be present in excess; to be redundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superabound;</hi> and: redundare aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to have an excess</hi> or <hi rend="ital">redundancy</hi> of any thing: redundat aurum ac thesauri patent, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 384, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (definitionibus) neque abesse quicquam decet neque redundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque in Antonio deesset hic ornatus orationis neque in Crasso redundaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla (species) neque praetermittatur neque redundet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitus indicibus fuit, quorum hodie copia redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidissimorum hominum multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redundante multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bonum mihi redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo posset urbs et accipere ex mari, quo egeret, et reddere, quo redundaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus vel ornamentis vel praesidiis redundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus deus non digito uno redundat, sed capite, collo, cervicibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi clientelis etiam exterarum nationum redundabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbissimo luctu redundaret ista victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curiana defensio tota redundavit hilaritate quādam et joco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdundans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redundant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amputatio et decussio redundantioris nitoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdundanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">redundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 21</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 82, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reduplicatio: <entryFree id="n40772" type="main" key="re^du^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdŭplĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>re-duplico</etym>, rhet. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">a)nadi/plwsis,</foreign> <sense id="n40772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repetition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 533</bibl>; Boëth. Aristot. Anal. 1, 38.</sense></entryFree>
reduplicatus: <entryFree id="n40773" type="hapax" key="re^dupli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-duplĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [duplico], <sense id="n40773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubled again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redoubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduplicated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
reduresco: <entryFree id="n40774" type="hapax" key="re^du_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-dūresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hard again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reduvia: <entryFree id="n40775" type="main" key="re^du^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdŭvĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭvĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n40775.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hangnail</hi> on the finger: <cit><quote lang="la">rediviam quidam, alii reluvium appellant, cum circa ungues cutis se resolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270, 17</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=271:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 271, 11</bibl> ib.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">redivia, Titin. ib.: reduviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 12, 37, § 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:40" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 8, § 40</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: cum capiti mederi debeam, reduviam curo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be busy about trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40775.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remainder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">escarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchyliorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reduviosus: <entryFree id="n40776" type="hapax" key="re^du^vi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdŭvĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕdĭv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reduvia</etym>, <sense id="n40776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of hangnails</hi>, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
redux: <entryFree id="n40777" type="main" key="re^dux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕdux</orth> (rēdux, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; id. <cb n="REFE" /> Capt. 5, 1, 2), dŭcis (<case>abl.</case> reduce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 50</bibl>: <sense id="n40777.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">reduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 1</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reduco</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40777.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that leads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brings back</hi> (mostly as an epithet of Jupiter and of Fortuna, in the poets and in inscrr.): <cit><quote lang="la">et sua det reduci vir meus arma Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 50</bibl></cit>; Sabin. Ep. 1, 78; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1256</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ubi Fortunae reducis fulgentia late Templa nitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:65:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 65, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 332</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">922</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1760</bibl> sq.; 1776; 3096; <cit><quote lang="la">4083: reduces choreae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that accompany home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:70:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 70, 9</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a human being only in the foll. passage: eo pervenimus, unde, nisi te reduce, nulli ad penates suos iter est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40777.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is led</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brought back</hi> (from slavery, imprisonment, from a distance, etc.), <hi rend="ital">come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">returned</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquem reducem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 77</bibl>; 3, 5, 28; 5, 1, 2; 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Orco in lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: quid me reducem esse voluistis? (i. e. <hi rend="ital">from exile</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 37, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores triumphantes domos reduces sistatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reduces in patriam ad parentes ad conjuges ac liberos facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 60, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navi reduce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesar exercitusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reduces socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 390</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 797</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratari aliquem reducem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(elephanti) non ante reduces ad agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reduces habenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 242</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the phœnix after being burned: reducisque parans exordia formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reexinanio: <entryFree id="n40778" type="hapax" key="re^exi^na_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-exĭnānĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to empty again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-empty</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in cacabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reexpecto: <entryFree id="n40779" type="main" key="re^expecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-expecto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to expect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">await again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 28, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refabrico: <entryFree id="n40780" type="main" key="re^fa_^bri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fā^brĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collapsum balneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refacta: <entryFree id="n40781" type="gloss" key="re^facta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfacta</orth>, v. reficio <sense id="n40781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
refactor: <entryFree id="n40782" type="main" key="re^factor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">re-maker</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">factor et refactor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joan. Tract. 38:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joan. Tract. 38, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refectio: <entryFree id="n40783" type="main" key="re^fecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕfict-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reficio</etym>, <sense id="n40783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repairing</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40783.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta, quae refectionem desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21:1:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 21, 1, § 7</bibl>. — In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40783.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">refreshment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recreation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recovery</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">relaxatio, remissio): etiam febre liberatus vix refectioni valebit,</quote> <trans><tr>will scarcely be strong enough to recover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora ad quietem refectionemque nobis data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum (with recreatur acies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinum perfrictionumque (oleum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 80</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae refectiones tuas arbores praetexerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40783.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, i. q. deversorium or cenaculum, transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kata/luma,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
