refector: <entryFree id="n40784" type="hapax" key="re^fector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repairer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coae Veneris, item Colossi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl></cit>; <itype>whence</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">refreshing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 67, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refectus: <entryFree id="n40785" type="main" key="re^fectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfectus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. reficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40786" type="main" key="re^fectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reficio</etym>. <sense id="n40786.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:78:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 78, § 12</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40786.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refreshment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recreation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
refello: <entryFree id="n40787" type="main" key="re^fello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fello</orth>, <itype>felli, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fallo, qs. falsum redarguere; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si id falsum fuerat, filius Cur non refellit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n40787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to show to be false; to disprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: refuto, redarguo): nosque ipsos redargui refellique patiamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: tu me <foreign lang="greek">gewmetrikw=s</foreign> refelleras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo licet mihi fingere, si quid velim, nullius memoriā jam me refellente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO">5, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:14" default="NO">12, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:2" default="NO">5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:36" default="NO">5, 7, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 1, 45: refellere et redarguere nostrum mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 380</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 644</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea magis exemplis quam argumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicta re et eventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 47, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refercio: <entryFree id="n40788" type="main" key="re^ferci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fercĭo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>farcio</etym>, <sense id="n40788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cram</hi> (class.; most freq. in the <pb n="1544" /> <cb n="REFE" /> <pos>P. a.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n40788.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministis tum judices, corporibus civium Tiberim compleri, cloacas referciri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: aerarium publicum, Avid. Cass. ap. Volcat. Avid. Cass. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Fortuna donis opimis refersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:266" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 266</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40788.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfice, ut Crassus quae coarctavit et peranguste refersit in oratione suā, dilatet nobis atque explicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures refersit istis sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros puerilibus fabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libris omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum vitam superstitione omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 63</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stuffed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crammed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled full.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40788.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (of things): <cit><quote lang="la">habere villas ornamentis refertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 126</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus ornatae ac refertae urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula Delos referta divitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: domus cupas taedā ac pice refertas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca referta praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera referta notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum celebritate refertissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xerxes refertus omnibus praemiis donisque fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum praemiis refertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refertus honestis studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita undique referta bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 86</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:294" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 294</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae refertae omni officio, diligentiā, suavitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl></cit> (15, a), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">refertae sententiis poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina referta contumeliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen crocodilis refertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 10</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> personae (less freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">domus erat aleatoribus referta, plena ebriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatis militibus refertum forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per refertum clientibus atrium prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40788.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (of persons): <cit><quote lang="la">referta Gallia negotiatorum est, plena civium Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 11</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. 1, 1): oppida hominum referta, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 501, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">referta quondam Italia Pythagoreorum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audieram refertam esse Graeciam sceleratissimorum hominum ac nefariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem refertam esse optimatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare refertum fore praedonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 20</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Very rarely of things: cum refertam urbem atque Italiam fanorum haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra referta regalis opulentiae capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus elephantorum refertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 15</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40788.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerebat, cur de hujusmodi nugis referti essent eorum libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 86</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40788.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suessam Pometiam urbem opulentam refertamque cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 45</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples ac referta domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: Asia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refertos agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique (Academici et Peripatetici) disciplinae formula plena et referta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">refertius aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:87:section=202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 87, § 202</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
referio: <entryFree id="n40789" type="main" key="re^fe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n40789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a</hi> , <hi rend="ital">to strike back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in return</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">patitor tu item, quom ego te referiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui referire non audebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussit te? recede. Referiendo enim et occasionem saepius feriendi dabis et excusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 1, 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 36, 56</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculi referitur imagine Phoebus,</quote> <trans><tr>is reflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 349</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 110</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">referitur vocibus Echo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
referiva: <entryFree id="n40790" type="main" key="re^fe^ri_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕfĕrīva</orth>, v. refriva.</entryFree>
refero: <entryFree id="n40791" type="main" key="re^fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-fĕro</orth>, <itype>rettŭli</itype> (also written retuli), rĕlātum (rēlātum or rellatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1001" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1001</bibl>), rĕferre, <sense id="n40791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. irr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">give back</hi> (very freq. and class.; cf.: reduco, reporto, retraho). </sense><sense id="n40791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40791.2" n="A" level="2"> Ingen.: zonas, quas plenas argenti extuli, eas ex provinciā inanes rettuli, C. Gracchus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">98</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply pallam, spinther,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvidum rete sine squamoso pecu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus aliquem in portum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster me ad tribulos tuos Rhegium rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: ut naves eodem, unde erant profectae,<cb n="REFE" />  reterrentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me referunt pedes in Tusculanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl></cit>, B; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem lecticae impositum domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in Palatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 16</bibl></cit>: intro referre pedem, <hi rend="ital">to turn one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s feet back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 50</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus tuum cave ad me rettuleris pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo rettulit illa pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertque refertque pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:334" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 334</bibl></cit> (for a different use of the phrase, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">in decimum vestigia rettulit annum (victoria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in convivia gressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:355" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in thalamos cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nomen caput ille refert,</quote> <trans><tr>turns his head</tr>, <tr>looks back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suumque Rettulit os in se,</quote> <trans><tr>drew back</tr>, <tr>concealed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Tuneta rursum castra refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in monumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relatis Lacedaemona (ossibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam non ad os, sed ad genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: digitos ad os referre, <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi> (v. digitus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitos ad frontem saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum ad capulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus enses vaginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:508" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias monumentaque, in templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput ejus in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneratos in locum tutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua (urorum) in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum omne ad se referri jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa militaria, scutum, litteras ad Caesarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris capite relato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n40791.3" n="b" level="4"> Esp.: referre se, <hi rend="ital">to go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam se rettulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se huc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum me Ad porri catinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese ab Argis (Juno),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se de Britannis ovans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam Cleanthes offert, cur se sol referat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.4" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. sense, <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin reiciemur, tamen eodem paulo tardius referamur necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem relatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc Itali in tergum versis referuntur habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:317" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 317</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:623" default="NO">7, 623</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.5" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines benignitatis introrsus referre,</quote> <trans><tr>to narrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:14:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seleucia ab mari relata,</quote> <trans><tr>remote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40791.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40791.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give back</hi> something due; <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi> (= reddere): <cit><quote lang="la">scyphos, quos utendos dedi Philodamo, rettuleritne?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, pateram (surreptam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; so (with reddere) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem (with reddere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">octonis idibus aera,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay the money for tuition</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 75</bibl></cit> (v. idus): <cit><quote lang="la">si non Rettuleris pannum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum, si plus dederis, referam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 112</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.8" n="2" level="3"> Referre pedem or gradum, as a milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi> (different from the gen. signif., to return, and the above passages): <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus defessi pedem referre coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut paulatim cedant ac pedem referant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">referre pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl></cit> (with loco excedere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3</bibl> (opp. insistere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60</bibl> (opp. restituitur pugna); <cit><quote lang="la">21, 8 al.— For the sake of euphony: referre gradum: cum pedes referret gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">And, in a like sense, once mid.: a primā acie ad triarios sensim referebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, out of the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">feroque viso retulit retro pedem (viator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viso rettulit angue pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:342" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 334</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rettulit ille gradus horrueruntque comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in judiciis) instare proficientibus et ab iis, quae non adjuvant, quam mollissime pedem oportet referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40791.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">give back.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40791.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: (Saxum) ejulatu ... Resonando mutum flebiles voces refert, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 176 Rib.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 201 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Coëamus rettulit Echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:387" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 387</bibl></cit>: cum ex CXXV. judicibus reus L. referret, <hi rend="ital">restored</hi> to the list, i. e. <hi rend="ital">retained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accepted</hi> (opp. quinque et LXX. reiceret), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mihi praeteritos referat si Juppiter annos!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 560</bibl></cit>; cf.: tibi <cb n="REFE" /> tempora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">festas luces (sae culum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies siccos (sol),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem jam periit: Ni quid tibi hinc in spem referas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amicam meras querimonias referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic in suam domum ignominiam et calamitatem rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro re certā spem falsam domum rettulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam sistere negat posse, nisi ad equestrem ordinem judicia referantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:96:section=223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 96, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servati civis decus referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e cursu populari referre aspectum in curiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn back</tr>, <tr>turn towards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos animumque ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad firmitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa dies variique labor mutabilis aevi Rettulit in melius,</quote> <trans><tr>brought to a better state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque se a scientiae delectatione ad efficiendi utilitatem refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se ad philosophiam referre,</quote> <trans><tr>to go back</tr>, <tr>return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo, unde digressa est, referat se oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 77</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40791.13" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To pay back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi> (syn. reddo): <cit><quote lang="la">denique Par pari referto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ab ipso adlatum est, id sibi esse relatum putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut puto, non poteris ipsa referre vicem,</quote> <trans><tr>pay him back in his own coin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 370</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1337" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1337</bibl>. — Esp. in the phrase referre gratiam (rarely gratias), <hi rend="ital">to return thanks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s gratitude</hi> (by deeds), <hi rend="ital">to recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requite</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam habeo): spero ego mihi quoque Tempus tale eventurum, ut tibi gratium referam parem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parem gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et habetur et refertur, Thais, a me ita, uti merita es, gratia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meritam gratiam debitamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justam ac debitam gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 26, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo mihi ac mereor relaturos esse gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti ut tibi numquam referre gratiam possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 36 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pro ejus meritis gratiam referre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam emeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 7, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 47</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tantis eorum in rem publicam meritis honores ei habeantur gratiaeque referantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis advenientem gratias pro meritis agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; v. gratia.— </sense><sense id="n40791.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring back</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, = repetere, retractare, renovare, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hecyram) Iterum referre,</quote> <trans><tr>to produce it again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. alt. 21 and 30; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 179</bibl>.— So, <hi rend="ital">to bring up for reconsideration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem judicatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 29, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludunt ... Dictaeos referunt Curetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actia pugna per pueros refertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 62</bibl></cit>: institutum referri ac renovari, Civ. Div. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:21:68" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 21, 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo longo intervallo repetita ac relata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 21:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te illud idem, quod tum explosum et ejectum est, nunc rettulisse demiror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad idem, unde semel profecta sunt, cuncta astra redierint eandemque totius caeli descriptionem longis intervallis retulerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysteria ad quae biduo serius veneram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasdam caerimonias ex magno intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquum morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem antiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aditus consul idem illud responsum rettulit,</quote> <trans><tr>repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem Valeriae gentis in liberandā patriā laudem,</quote> <trans><tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc morem, hos casus atque haec certamina primus Ascanius Rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O mihi praeteritos referat si Juppiter annos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 560</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproduce</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">referre Naturam, mores, victum motusque parentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to reproduce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum vultus vocesque comasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores, os vultusque ejus (sc. patris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis sui speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tellus) partim figuras Rettulit antiquas, partim nova monstra creavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem demptā pelle novam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis illius vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 443</bibl></cit>: si quis mihi parvulus aulā Luderet Aeneas, qui te tamen ore <pb n="1545" /> <cb n="REFE" /> referret, <hi rend="ital">might represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemble thee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 329</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine avum referens, animo manibusque parentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsigni sermone vultuque Suevos referunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque amissos colores lana refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.16" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To convey a report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligence</hi>, by speech or by writing; <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount; to mention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allege</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">in late Lat. saepissime): certorum hominum sermones referebantur ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales miserrima fletus Fertque refertque soror (sc. ad Aeneam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam referunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum dictumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis hoc referat exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in epistulis Cicero haec Bruti refert verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale refert Cicero de homine praelongo, caput eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 67</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecunque refers,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum referens de Maecenate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 66</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 700</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 796</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Celso gaudere et bene rem gerere refer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 2 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> by Greek attraction: <cit><quote lang="la">quia rettulit Ajax Esse Jovis pronepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 141</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">referre aliquid in annales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, and 43, 13, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Proetum mulier perfida credulum Falsis impulerit criminibus, refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum, inquam, debetis? Respondent CVI. Refero ad Scaptium,</quote> <trans><tr>I report</tr>, <tr>announce it to Scaptius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo primum saepe aliter est dictum, aliter ad nos relatum,</quote> <trans><tr>reported</tr>, <tr>stated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:288" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hortensius) nullo referente, omnia adversariorum dicta meminisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi, quaere, et refer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 53</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40791.17" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> (mostly in Ovid), <hi rend="ital">to repeat to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call to mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitāque recentia mente Visa refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte refers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec refer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe refer tecum sceleratae facta puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:299" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente memor refero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda Lycaoniae referens convivia mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 165</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illam meminitque refertque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:563" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 563</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40791.18" n="c" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to say in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rejoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi> (syn. respondeo): <cit><quote lang="la">id me non ad meam defensionem attulisse, sed illorum defensioni rettulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 29, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi refero,</quote> <trans><tr>I reply to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 85</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">84: ut si esset dictum, etc., et referret aliquis Ergo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid a nobis autem refertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: retices; <cit><quote lang="la">nec mutua nostris Dicta refers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 656</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 696</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:337" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 337</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 278</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anna refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia voce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem pauca refert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 333</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n40791.19" n="d" level="4"> Publicists' t. t. </sense><sense id="n40791.20" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi> any thing as an official report, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notify</hi>, = renuntiare: <cit><quote lang="la">legati haec se ad suos relaturos dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus orationem legati domum referunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: responsa (legati), Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 380, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationem Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum capitum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores excipere et ad aliquem referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii paucis diebus intermissis referunt, Suevos omnes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.21" n="(b)" level="5"> Ad senatum de aliquā re referre (less freq with <case>acc.</case>, a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to make a motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi> in the Senate; <hi rend="ital">to consult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay before</hi> the Senate; <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>: VTI L. PAVLVS C. MARCELLVS COSS... DE CONSVLARIBVS PROVINCIIS AD SENATVM REFERRENT, NEVE QVID PRIVS ... AD SENATVM REFERRENT, NEVE QVID CONIVNCTVM DE EA RE REFERRETVR A CONSVLIBVS, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5 sq.</bibl>: de legibus abrogandis ad senatum referre. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cornel. 1</bibl>, Fragm. 8 (p. 448 Orell.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo legando consules spero ad senatum relaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ejus honore ad senatum referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eā re postulant uti referatur. Itaque consulente Cicerone frequens senatus decernit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad senatum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc relata ex integro res ad senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul convocato senatu refert, quid de his fieri placeat, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 3</bibl></cit>: ut ex litteris ad senatum referretur, impetrari (a consulibus)<cb n="REFE" />  non potuit. Referunt consules de re publicā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">refer, inquis, ad senatum. Non referam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of other bodies than the Senate (cf.: defero, fero): C. Cassium censorem de signo Concordiae dedicando ad pontificum collegium rettulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 53, 136</bibl></cit>: eam rem ad consilium cum rettulisset Fabius. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quod referam ad consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 31, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Per syllepsin</hi>: DE EA RE AD SENATVM POPVLVMQVE REFERRI, since referre ad populum was not used in this sense (for ferre ad populum); v. fero, and the foll. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hoc (sc. Eumene) Antigonus ad consilium rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a reference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refer</hi> (class.): de rebus et obscuris et incertis ad Apollinem censeo referendum; <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem etiam Athenienses publice de majoribus rebus semper rettulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl>.— Different from this is, * </sense><sense id="n40791.22" n="(g)" level="5"> Referre ad populum (for denuo ferre), <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refer</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">anew to the people</hi> (cf. supra, II. B. 2.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1006): factum est illorum aequitate et sapientiā consulum, ut id, quod senatus decreverat, id postea referendum ad populum non arbitrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 512, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.23" n="e" level="4"> A mercantile and publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to note down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi> any thing in writing; <hi rend="ital">to inscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scirem, ita indicium in tabulas publicas relatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabulas quodcumque commodum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen in tabulas, in codicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquum in commentarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in libellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas epistulas in volumina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to admit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem in Origines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 89 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in reos, in proscriptos referri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be set down among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentem in reos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inter proscriptos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulos quoque depositos a nobilitate, in annales relatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs consulta falsa (sc. in aerarium),</quote> <trans><tr>enter</tr>, <tr>register</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 12</bibl>. —Entirely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nec triumviri accipiundo nec scribae referundo sufficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Here, too, belongs referre rationes or aliquid (in rationibus, ad aerarium, ad aliquem, alicui), <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">render an account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes totidem verbis referre ad aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and rationes referre alone: in rationibus referendis ... rationum referendarum jus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 71, § 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre rationes publicas ad Caesarem cum fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hanc ex fenore pecuniam populo non rettuleris, reddas societati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pecuniam) in aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:57:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 57, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: pecuniam operi publico, <hi rend="ital">to charge to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to set down as applied to</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl>.— So, too, acceptum and in acceptum referre, <hi rend="ital">to place to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s credit</hi>, in a lit. and trop. sense (v. accipio).— Hence, transf.: aliquem (aliquid) in numero (as above, in rationibus), in numerum, etc., <hi rend="ital">to count</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Democritus, qui imagines eorumque circuitus in deorum numero refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar, Claudius) in deorum numerum relatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponticus Heraclides terram et caelum refert in deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri oratorii libri in Eundem librorum numerum referendi videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: hoc nomen in codicem relatum, id. Rosc. Com. B. and K. (al. in codice).—With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> (postAug. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter deos referretur (August.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem inter festos, nefastos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi tamen inter Germanos referuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque refert inter meritorum maxima, demptos Aesonis esse situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectum est, quod inter divos quoque referretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sidera referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 192" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter praecipua crudelitatis indicia referendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">inter insulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebat quasdam esse quaestiones, quae deberent inter res judicatas referri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem Q. Caepionem referrem,</quote> <trans><tr>I should place in the same category</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:223" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 223</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.24" n="4" level="3"> Referre aliquid ad aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to trace back</hi>, <cb n="REFE" /> <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer</hi> a thing to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pecudum ritu ad voluptatem omnia referunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad igneam vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad incolumitatem et ad libertatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in historiā quaeque ad veritatem, in poëmate pleraque ad delectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl> et saep. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ipsum finem definiebas id esse, quo omnia, quae recte fierent, referrentur, neque id ipsum usquam referretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad commonendum oratorem, quo quidque referat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc omne principium, huc refer exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus adversa pravitati ipsius, prospera ad fortunam referebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — In Tac. once with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid ubique magnificum est, in claritatem ejus (sc. Herculis) referre consensimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of persons; <cit><quote lang="la">as: tuum est Caesar, quid nunc mihi animi sit, ad te ipsum referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ita inserere oportet referentem ad fructum, meliore genere ut sit surculus, etc., <hi rend="ital">one who looks to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cares for the fruit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40791.25" n="5" level="3"> Culpam in aliquem referre, <hi rend="ital">to throw the blame upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold responsible for</hi>, etc. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic, quod in adversis rebis solet fieri, alius in alium culpam referebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; Aug. contr. Man. 2, 17, 25 <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Epp. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">augere ejus, in quem referet crimen, culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:28:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa ad matrem referebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam abscessus ad Sejani artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
refert: <entryFree id="n40792" type="main" key="re_fert"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēfert</orth> (or separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">rē fert</orth>), <itype>tŭlit, ferre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> (<number>plur.</number> rarely personal; v. II. infra) [res - fero; the ancients regarded rē in this word as derived from res; cf. Fest. s. v. refert, p. 282 Müll.]; prop., it follows from or in view of a thing, i. q. ex re est; hence, <hi rend="ital">it is for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s interest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it profits;</hi> or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">it befits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concerns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is of importance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi> (syn.: juvat, conducit, attinet; freq. and class.); constr., </sense><sense id="n40792.1" n="I" level="1"> In all periods and in all kinds of composition, <hi rend="ital">refert hoc</hi> (<hi rend="ital">id</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illud</hi>, etc., a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>) <hi rend="ital">meā</hi> (<hi rend="ital">tuā</hi>, etc., qs. fert re meā, tuā, etc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1077</bibl> P.) <hi rend="ital">magni</hi> (<hi rend="ital">pluris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quanti</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">nihil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quid?</hi>), or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40792.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Hoc meā refert</hi>, etc. (in Cic. very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas interest meā occurs very freq.): tua istuc refert maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua istuc refert, si curaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id mea minime refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod refert tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo pol pluris tua hoc, quam quanti illud refert meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meā quidem istuc nihil refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tuā refert nihil, utrum illae fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā quod nihil refert, ne Cures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā quod nihil refert, percontari desinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ascripsi id, quod tuā nihil referebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid id meā refert?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid id refert tuā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 11</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid meā refert, hae Athenis natae an Thebis sient?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40792.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Hoc refert</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo habeas, illud refert, jurene an injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illud quidem refert, consul an dictator an praetor spoponderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud permagni referre arbitror, Ut ne scientem sentiat te id sibi dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum illud parvi refert, nos publicanis amissis vectigalia postea victoria reciperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni quod refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at quibus servis? refert enim magno opere id ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: quanti id refert? Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi retulit Non suscepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi refert abs te ipso jus dici aequabiliter, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti refert, te nec recte dicere, qui nihili faciat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meminero, sed quid meminisse id refert?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi refert Chrysalo esse nomen, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:53" default="NO"
